chapters.title: Chapter 148: Private (2)
chapters.content:
As the families and relatives exited the auditorium, a heavy silence settled over the room.
From one corner of the auditorium’s entrance, drill instructors wearing red caps briskly approached.
The newly enlisted soldiers, still unfamiliar with military life, hesitated, merely observing their surroundings without daring to act.
But it didn’t matter. Drill instructors could instill fear in recruits even in the midst of such stillness.
“Hey… Line up and stay still. Don’t move.”
At the deep, commanding voice of one instructor, the recruits flinched.
I stood upright, keeping my posture firm, but the recruit in front of me shifted his body ever so slightly.
“You there.”
“Y-Yes?!”
“Step out.”The recruit in front hurriedly placed his belongings to the side and began to stand.
It was only a brief moment, but the instructor didn’t miss it and roared in a thunderous voice.
“Get out here—NOW!!”
The instructor’s shout echoed through the auditorium, and the recruit who had become the unfortunate example quickly stepped forward.
“Hey… Are you here to play around?”
“No, sir…!”
“I told you not to move just now, didn’t I? So why did you move?”
“I’m sorry, sir…”
“Drop down.”
Without hesitation, the recruit got down on the auditorium floor.
“When I say ‘one,’ go down and focus. When I say ‘two,’ come up and get ready. One!”
“Focus!”
“Two.”
“Get ready!”
“One.”
“Focus!”
“Two.”
“Get ready!”
“Two.”
“Focus!”
“I said TWO! Why are you going down?! Are you not focused?!”
This… hasn’t changed at all over the years.
While watching the scene unfold, another recruit accidentally made eye contact with the instructor.
“You, step out too.”
“Yes, sir…!”
The recruit, overwhelmed by the atmosphere, stepped forward as well.
The situation made me want to sigh, but I knew that even the slightest exhale could instantly make me the next “motivational example.”
I stared straight ahead, not moving my eyes an inch.
After a long session of “motivation,” we were finally instructed to move to the barracks.
“Attention!”
“Attention!”
“Attention!!”
“Attention!!!”
It hadn’t even been a full day, yet life already felt exhausting.
“We’re heading to the barracks now. Line up in rows, keeping pace with the person in front and beside you. Got it?”
“Yes.”
“That’s all you’ve got?!”
“Yes, sir!”
“When I call for rows and columns, you shout it back loud and clear. Got it?”
“Yes, sir!”
It was raining outside, so we put on our issued raincoats and headed straight to the barracks.
Marching in step, we arrived and immediately took in the all-too-familiar sights of the barracks.
Neatly folded uniforms and training clothes lined the locker shelves, with mats and neatly arranged blue blankets placed underneath.
It truly hit me—I was in the military now.
But the real wake-up call? That would come tomorrow morning.
“Now, we’re going to tell you your unit. You’re part of the 3rd Company, 3rd Platoon. Understood?”
“Yes, sir!”
“What’s your unit?”
“3rd Company, 3rd Platoon, sir!”
After assigning us to our units, they moved on to the next step: explaining how to introduce ourselves with rank and number.
“Next, I’ll explain how to state your rank and name. Let’s say this guy’s name is Hong Gil-dong. If a superior calls on him, he needs to state his assigned number, rank, and name. Got it? You’ll also include your platoon number in front of your assigned number. You there.”
The instructor pointed at me.
I was surprised; the distance between us was considerable, and I hadn’t expected to be singled out.
“Private 315, Lee Han-gyeol!”
“That’s how you do it. Understood?”
“Yes, sir!”
After that, perhaps because it was still the orientation phase, we weren’t given anything too intense.
Instead, we spent the time silently filling out forms and surveys.
The chaotic first night as a new recruit began. With the exception of the sleeping light, all other lights were turned off.
As I lay down, I could hear restless shuffling and quiet sighs, likely from others feeling uncomfortable in their new beds.
I wanted to let out a sigh myself, but I needed to fall asleep before the others started snoring.
I thought to myself: If only I wake up tomorrow and find out this is all just a dream… and Eun-ha is right by my side.
****
“Wake up, wake up! All recruits of the 2nd Battalion, wake up immediately, tidy your bedding, open the windows, and report to the assembly field by 6:10 a.m. after using the communal facilities. Wake up, wake up!”
Dream? Yeah, right. The moment I opened my eyes, all I heard was the instructor’s voice echoing through the room and the sight of my fellow recruits’ defeated faces.
Some buried their heads in their pillows, silently screaming, while others stared out the window, letting out sighs.
As the thought of it’s only been one day filled my mind, I found myself staring at the ceiling and muttering:
“We’re screwed…”
Before I had time to fully process the reality of being in the military, time kept ticking on.
“I know more than 500 species of grasshoppers. O / X*”
This question was still here.
Why does this even exist?
I half-wished for a question like, “Have you served in the military twice?”
Though I couldn’t mark “O,” it’d at least provide some kind of twisted comfort.
The day passed with more surveys, physical examinations, meetings with the platoon leader, and then…
“If you’re on the parade ground, stomp your feet—HARD!”
“You there, step out! If you think it’s you, then ALL of you, step out!”
“You! Didn’t I tell you to wear your mask properly? Didn’t you hear me?!”
“EVERYONE, DROP DOWN!”
The instructor’s shouts and “motivational sessions” continued endlessly.
We spent the day dropping down, standing up, and repeating the cycle over and over.
As the days passed, the laughter disappeared from the faces of my fellow recruits. Instead of pop songs, they began humming military songs.
The restroom became the communal facility.
Putting hands in our pockets became “hand immersion.”
Touching anything was now called “tactile engagement.”
After the evening roll call, I lay down in bed, only to have the recruit next to me strike up a conversation.
“Man… I really wanna go home. Your name’s Han-gyeol Lee, right?”
“Yeah.”
“I noticed you never get called out by the instructors. Have you been through boot camp before?”
“There’s a sad story behind that, so don’t ask.”
“Man, I wish the weekend would come already… I wanna use my phone.”
“Can we use our phones to make calls?”
“Calls can only be made through the public phone. You just get to use your phone for other stuff.”
“Ah, that’s a bummer.”
“Well, it’s better than nothing.”
“Yeah, you’re right. Anyway, let’s get some sleep before everyone starts snoring.”
“Yeah. Gotta sleep while we can. Night.”
“Good night to you too.”
I wonder how it’ll feel to finally turn on my phone this weekend.
****
Weekend Phone Calls
We couldn’t make voice calls with the phones distributed on weekends, but for an hour, I could exchange messages with Eun-ha and read the diary entries and letters she had sent me daily.
Not being able to hear her voice was disappointing, but the abundance of selfies she sent helped ease the longing.
When the second weekend came around during Chuseok*, we were granted a special five-minute call through the communal phones.
“Attention!”
“Attention!”
“Attention!!”
“Attention!!”
The drill instructor had us seated in the hallway outside the phone room and began giving instructions.
“From now on, each of you will make a phone call. The five-minute timer starts the moment I tell you to dial, not when the call connects. Got it?”
“Yes, sir!”
“And don’t laugh too loudly or giggle. Don’t forget you’re soldiers now. Understood?”
“Yes, sir!”
“Let me hear your voices—UNDERSTOOD?”
“Yes, sir!!”
My fellow recruits, clearly excited, shouted even louder.
“If only you spoke this loud normally. Numbers 1 through 8, head into the phone room.”
One by one, the recruits went into the phone room in groups of eight.
When they came out after their five-minute calls, not a single one left without tears streaming down their faces.
“Next, numbers 9 through 16, go in.”
I entered with my group and sat down in front of a communal phone. I planned to call my parents first, leaving about 2 minutes and 30 seconds to call Eun-ha.
“Pick up the receiver and start dialing now!”
“Yes, sir!”
In unison, we picked up the phones and began making collect calls. After a few rings, there was a click, and I heard my mother’s voice.
-“Is this my son?!”
The moment I heard her voice, tears welled up in my eyes. I thought I’d hold it together, but the emotions were overwhelming, and I started crying.
Most of the others were biting their lips or stuffing their fists into their mouths, struggling to keep their calls going.
I hadn’t meant to worry her, but all the pent-up sadness hit me at once.
Through trembling lips, I managed to respond.
“Yes… It’s me!”
-“Honey! It’s our son! He’s calling!”
-“Really? Let me talk to him! Son! How are you holding up?!”
“I’m doing fine…! Sniff…!”
The conversation didn’t flow well at first, but gradually, I calmed down and continued talking with my parents for about two minutes.
-“You should call Eun-ha too! She must be waiting desperately!”
“Yes. Did she make it home safely that day?”
-“Oh, she cried so much in the car. Go call her now!”
“Yes, I will. I’ll call you again later! Have a wonderful Chuseok!”
After ending the call with my parents, I steadied myself and dialed Eun-ha. My heart pounded as the phone rang, and then I heard her voice.
-“Han-gyeol?! Is it you?!”
“Yes, it’s me. What were you doing?”
-“Thinking about you, of course! How are you? Are the meals okay? Are you sleeping well? Are you hurt anywhere? How long can we talk?!”
“I think I have a little over two minutes left. Are you doing well?”
-“Yes…! I’m doing fine… What about you? Are you really okay?”
Her voice quivered, and it was clear she had started crying as soon as she heard me.
“I’m fine, really. I’m eating well and sleeping fine.”
Hearing her voice felt like all the hardships of the past week were being washed away.
-“Really?! You’re not lying, are you?”
“Of course not. What have you been up to?”
-“I’ve been going to college like you told me, working on lots of assignments, and doing well…! Don’t worry about me!”
“Eun-ha, are you crying right now?”
-“N-No, I’m not…!”
“You sound like you’re crying~”
When I teased Eun-ha, Eunwoo Hyung’s voice suddenly came through the receiver.
-“Han-gyeol-ah! She’s totally bawling right now~”
-“Oppa, get out! I’m on the phone with Han-gyeol!”
-“I’m also on the phone with Han-gyeol~”
-“Seriously, you’re the worst!”
It seemed she was back at her family’s house for Chuseok.
“Are you at home?”
-“Yeah…! I came home for Chuseok. My brother and mom both wanted to hear your voice too—”
-“Han-gyeol, are you okay? Are you eating and sleeping well?”
This time, it was her mom’s voice.
“Yes, I’m doing well, ma’am.”
-“Eun-ha, we’ll leave you to talk. Just for a little bit, okay?”
-“Thanks, Mom!”
For the first time since enlisting, a smile crossed my face.
-“Han-gyeol!”
“Yes, Eun-ha?”
-“Hehe… Hearing your voice makes me so happy.”
“You weren’t just crying, were you?”
-“It’s all because of Eunwoo Oppa… Anyway! Did you already call your mom?”
“Yes, I talked to her just before calling you. How was your trip back home that day?”
-“It was fine! I got back safely!”
“They said you cried a lot on the way home~”
-“Ugh… I couldn’t help it, okay…! I miss you, Gyeol!”
“I miss you too.”
-“Really?! I’ll send you more pictures! And more letters!”
“Don’t overdo it. I’m just glad to hear you’re doing well.”
As we continued talking, the instructor’s voice cut in from behind.
“One minute left!”
Feeling the urgency, I quickly spoke to Eun-ha.
“Eun-ha, they said there’s one minute left. I’m doing fine, so don’t worry about me. Thank you so much for all the pictures, letters, and diary entries you’ve sent. I’m so happy to hear you’re okay. Just hold on for three more weeks until the graduation ceremony.”
-“Okay, I’ll see you at the ceremony! I’m so thankful for all your messages, and I’m so glad you’re staying healthy…! Han-gyeol, I love you! You know I love you so much, right?!”
“I know… I love you too.”
I lowered my voice, embarrassed in front of my fellow recruits and the instructor.
“I love you.”
Just as I said it, the instructor’s voice boomed again.
“Ten seconds left! Wrap up your calls!”
I hurried to say my last words.
“Eun-ha, I have to go now. Eat well and take care of yourself! I’ll call you again next week!”
-“Okay! I love you! I love you more than anything in the world! I’ll write you even more letters—love you!”
“I love you too. Goodbye for now.”
-“Bye!”
I gently placed the receiver back on its cradle.
I never thought five minutes could feel so short.
Like the others, I left the phone room with red, teary eyes.
I miss her so much, it’s unbearable.
--- The End OF The Chapter --
[TL: ‘I know more than 500 species of grasshoppers. O / X’ - This kind of question in Korean military forms serves more as a psychological tool or a formality rather than having a literal purpose.
Chuseok: It is a Korean holiday that celebrates the autumn harvest and honors ancestors.

chapters.title: Chapter 149: Private First Class (1)
chapters.content:
A new year has arrived, and January is here.
Both Han-gyeol and I have turned 21, and it has already been five months since Han-gyeol enlisted in the military.
Thanks to his excellent grades at the training center and specialty school, Han-gyeol was assigned to a unit in Seoul.
I can still vividly recall the excitement in Han-gyeol’s voice when he called to tell me the news after his assignment was confirmed.
At first, it was challenging, but we’ve gradually adapted to our current life.
As promised before his enlistment, I visit Han-gyeol at least once every two weeks.
Similarly, Han-gyeol has kept his promise to call me daily, sharing an hour of his day as we chat about everything and anything.
We’re maintaining our relationship beautifully, without feeling burdened by obligations.
There are moments of longing, but no feelings of disappointment, and I love how balanced and fulfilling our relationship is.
Today is the day Han-gyeol gets a leave of absence, so I woke up early in the morning.Even though he tells me not to go overboard preparing a feast for his visits, I can’t help but want to.
When I ask what he’d like to eat, he always requests simple dishes, so today, I decided to make what I wanted to cook.
I prepared a pot of braised pork ribs and also set aside some salmon for dinner.
Since I left early, it’s almost time for Han-gyeol to arrive.
Even though we see each other every two weeks, those two weeks feel unbearably long, making our meetings even more precious.
Before long, I heard the sound of the door lock turning, and the door started to open.
However, it stopped partway with a clink.
“Eun-ha, I’m here! Can you unlock the door for me?”
“Oh, right! The safety latch. Hold on a second!”
I unlatched the safety lock that Han-gyeol had installed during his last leave.
As the door opened, Han-gyeol walked in with a bright smile.
“I missed you so much~”
The moment he saw me, Han-gyeol hugged me tightly and wouldn’t let go.
“I missed you too~”
Ever since he enlisted, every time we meet, Han-gyeol greets me with a tight hug.
This time, he held me even more firmly than before, making my heart race.
“How have you been?”
“I’ve been great! How about you, Han-gyeol?”
“I’m doing really well. Have you eaten yet?”
“I waited so I could eat with you. Unless you’d rather I eat first?”
“Your jokes keep getting bolder every time I’m on leave~”
“That’s just how much I’ve missed you!”
I rubbed my face against his chest playfully.
“Let’s eat already. You didn’t prepare a full feast again, did you?”
“What? No way! I just made braised pork ribs.”
“That’s so much work! I told you not to overdo it.”
“I just want to feed you delicious food~”
“Alright, alright. It smells amazing!”
“Hehe. Go change your clothes first.”
“Sure, just a minute.”
Han-gyeol kicked off his large military boots and stepped inside.
He took off his uniform and placed his dog tags on the table.
When he removed his inner shirt, I caught a glimpse of his abs.
They seemed even more defined than last time… so sexy.
“Han-gyeol, do you work out a lot in the military?”
“Huh? Oh, yeah. I work out daily with my senior. Why?”
“…Your muscles look bigger compared to your last leave.”
“Really? Looks like it’s paying off!”
“Can I touch them?”
“That’s embarrassing…”
“I want to feel them!”
I dashed into the room without hesitation.
“I haven’t even finished changing.”
“It’s fine. Take your time!”
When I pressed my fingers against his arm, they barely sank into the firm muscles.
“Wow, so solid…”
“Eun-ha, this is really embarrassing.”
“Are you overdoing it with the workouts in the military? Don’t push yourself too hard and get injured.”
“Don’t worry~ I only work out during physical training. It’s not like I’ve gained that much muscle.”
“You even seem a bit taller!”
“That’d be nice. Now, let me finish changing, okay?”
“Okay, okay. I’ll serve the food, so hurry up!”
“Got it~”
After admiring Han-gyeol’s physique, I returned to the kitchen.
As I scooped rice into bowls, my face felt warm.
Muscular Han-gyeol… He’s so sexy, I think his image will linger in my mind for a while.
Tonight… hehe… just thinking about it makes me happy.
I couldn’t stop smiling.
“Eun-ha, I’m done changing.”
“Ah! Oh, okay! Let’s eat quickly.”
“What were you thinking about? You’re grinning like crazy.”
“Nothing at all! Let’s just eat! Since you’re working out, eat a lot!”
“Thanks. I’ll enjoy the meal!”
Watching Han-gyeol enjoy his food made me fall in love with him all over again.
“Is anything at the base bothering you these days?”
“Clearing snow on snowy days is a bit annoying, but that’s about it.”
“How about your seniors? Are they treating you well?”
“They’re not overly kind, but they don’t pick on me for no reason either.”
“You’re getting promoted to Corporal in May, right?”
“Yeah. Wonder when I’ll make Sergeant~”
“Have any new recruits joined?”
“Yep. We’re all getting along pretty well. My peers are really nice too.”
“What about the new recruits?”
“They’re kind. One of them is two years older than me, but he’s still very respectful.”
“That’s a relief.”
“Are you still worried about me, Eun-ha?”
Han-gyeol looked into my eyes as he asked.
“A little~”
“Don’t worry about me~ I’m doing fine.”
“Okay! Oh, sorry for distracting you with questions. Eat up.”
“Alright. You too, Eun-ha.”
After breakfast, Han-gyeol cleaned up.
I tried to help, but he kept picking me up and tossing me onto the bed, so I just watched his back as he worked.
At first, I was so worried about Han-gyeol being in the military, but now, I’ve gotten somewhat used to it.
I miss him and long for him, but my emotions don’t swing wildly anymore.
“What are you doing today, Eun-ha?”
“I have to attend my winter semester class later.”
“What about after that? Any plans?”
“I’ll probably work on editing until dinner.”
“Oh, you mean that editing job you mentioned before?”
I’ve been working a part-time editing job with a senior from my department.
At first, I started it to fill the time without Han-gyeol, but it turned out to be both educational and surprisingly lucrative.
“Yeah, if I work late, I’ll probably finish by six.”
“Got it. Then I’ll head to campus to study and have lunch with you. Is that okay?”
“Huh?! It’s your leave. Are you sure you’re okay studying?”
“It’s something I do every day anyway~”
Even in the military, Han-gyeol spends his time diligently.
Honestly, he seems more dedicated to making good use of his time than I am.
“Do you have plans today, Han-gyeol?”
“I’m meeting Yujin. They said their schedule is flexible, so I’ll see them in the afternoon. Let’s have dinner together, though.”
“Okay! What time will you be back?”
“By six-thirty at the latest.”
“Alright~”
“Don’t prepare dinner in advance, okay? Let’s cook together.”
“Sure~ I only have plans today. Starting tomorrow, let’s go on a date.”
“Sounds perfect~”
“I think so too!”
We’ve been spending time together while being mindful of each other’s needs.
I think it was a really good decision to agree not to feel obligated to each other before his enlistment.
By respecting and understanding each other’s lives, we haven’t had a single argument.
“Shouldn’t we get going? I’ll walk you there.”
“Yeah!”
Han-gyeol walked me to my class for the winter semester.
As we held hands tightly, my heart pounded wildly.
Since we don’t have physical contact every day, these moments make me so nervous.
Still, having Han-gyeol by my side every day would be the best.
“Eun-ha, is there anything you want to eat? I’ll make it for you tomorrow.”
“Then… I’d like to have your kimchi stew!”
“Sure~ After we eat, let’s go watch a movie.”
“Yeah! Should I book the tickets?”
“I’ll do it since I get a military discount.”
“Wow, you’re so frugal~”
“Right?”
Seeing Han-gyeol’s bright smile made me so happy.
I couldn’t help but squeeze his hand even tighter.
“This feels so nice! It’s been a while since I’ve gone to campus with you.”
“Same here.”
Matching my grip, Han-gyeol held my hand tightly as well.
“What’s the first thing you want to do when you’re discharged?”
“Hm~ Is it okay to think about that already?”
“It’s just for fun~”
“No matter how much I think about it, all I want to do is spend time with you. Just living with you again, like before I enlisted, feels like it would be enough.”
Even though I hear his voice every day, there’s nothing better than listening to it face-to-face like this.
When I look at his excited expression, his emotions reach me even more deeply.
“Han-gyeol, you really like me, don’t you?”
“Should I tone it down?”
“No! Feel free to like me even more. I’m growing fonder of you, too!”
“Even if you didn’t say that, I’m already liking you more and more.”
“Me too! I feel even closer to you!”
Even though Han-gyeol isn’t always physically by my side, I don’t feel lonely.
In high school, I used to think I needed to be with him every moment, but now, it doesn’t seem necessary.
Some might think that this means our love has faded, but that’s not true at all.
Now, even without words or constant proximity, I know how deeply we care for each other.
No matter where I am or what I’m doing, I’m certain of Han-gyeol’s love for me.
And I’m sure he knows just as clearly that I’ll always love him.
Without saying it out loud, we understand each other’s hearts and cherish one another.
We’ve gone beyond simply sharing our lives—we’ve become each other’s lives.
I feel like I’ve matured compared to my high school days.
And because I’ve grown up…!
“Han-gyeol!”
“Yeah? What’s up?”
“Hehe~ Let’s stay up late tonight!”
“Guess I’ll have to skip the morning movie~”
“Exactly! I’m going to keep you up really late~”
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 150: Private First Class (2)
chapters.content:
Eun-ha was beaming with excitement at the rare chance for a movie theater date, her face lit up with a radiant smile. Holding a tub of popcorn close to her chest, she grinned so brightly that just looking at her made me happy too.
Moments like these were impossible to experience back in the military, so I was determined to savor it to the fullest.
I already dreaded going back.
“Eun-ha, you’re super excited, huh? Is going to the theater really that fun?”
“Of course! We didn’t get to hangout properly yesterday~. It’s been so long since I’ve been to the movies with Han-gyeol, so I’m really happy. Han-gyeol, are you happy too?”
“I am. Now, let’s head up one more floor to the screening room.”
“Okay, okay! Let’s go!”
We took the escalator up one more floor, Eun-ha standing a step ahead of me. She suddenly turned around and popped a piece of popcorn into my mouth.
“Han-gyeol, say ‘Ah~.’”
“Ah~.”“Is it good?”
“Yeah, it’s delicious.”
“Then I’ll give you more.”
She kept feeding me piece after piece until, by the time we reached the screening room, my cheeks were puffed out like a chipmunk’s.
Seeing this, Eun-ha giggled brightly.
“Han-gyeol, you look like a squirrel with your cheeks all stuffed!”
I swallowed all the popcorn in my mouth and took a sip of my drink. Then, it was my turn. I offered her a piece of popcorn, but Eun-ha kept her lips tightly shut, refusing to eat.
When I playfully tapped her lips with the popcorn, she finally laughed and took a bite.
“My tint’s going to smudge!”
“But it’s tasty, right?”
“Yeah, it’s been so long since I’ve had this. Give me more.”
“Nope. The movie hasn’t even started yet, and half the popcorn is already gone.”
I showed her the half-empty tub, and she looked up at me, pouting.
“You’re so stingy, Han-gyeol. You’re the one eating it all!”
“You’re the one who kept feeding me!”
“Fine, then let’s finish this quickly and lift the armrest. I want to link arms while we watch.”
“No way. I want to eat popcorn while watching the movie.”
“You’ve eaten plenty~. Hand it over. I’ll finish it.”
Eun-ha reached out for the popcorn, but I quickly pulled it out of her reach.
“I told you, you kept feeding me, so no.”
“Huh? You’re really not going to share?”
“Nope. Not a chance—”
“Hey!”
Before I could finish my sentence, Eun-ha lunged for the popcorn, but her short arms couldn’t reach it.
“Nice try, but no chance~.”
“If I snatch it, it’s all mine!”
“Go ahead and try.”
Eun-ha stretched and wiggled her arms in an attempt to grab the tub, but she couldn’t manage. Our playful tug-of-war ended with a compromise: we raised the armrest, and I kept the popcorn.
As soon as the armrest was lifted, Eun-ha hooked her arm around mine and rested her head on my shoulder.
“Han-gyeol, is this uncomfortable for you?”
“Not at all. Actually, I like it better being close like this.”
“Hehe, I like it too. If I tap your arm, feed me popcorn, okay?”
“Got it. The movie’s about to start. Did you turn off your phone?”
“Of course~. If your arm gets heavy, let me know.”
“Sure thing. Let’s enjoy the movie”
“Don’t just look at the screen, okay?”
“You don’t just look at me, either~.”
“Hehe, okay. Oh, it’s starting!”
The theater lights dimmed, and the movie began. Since this was a film Eun-ha had been excited to see, we both focused on the screen at first.
Every now and then, when she tapped my arm, I’d pop a piece of popcorn into her mouth. Watching her silently take the popcorn without a word was adorable—she reminded me of a chipmunk scurrying around the base.
About halfway through the movie, Eun-ha tapped my arm again. I reached for a piece of popcorn, but an amusing idea struck me: what if I didn’t feed her?
Curious about her reaction, I ignored her signal and kept my eyes glued to the screen.
I could feel her shift slightly, her head lifting off my shoulder. She stared at me intently, her lips pressed together as if to stifle a laugh.
Then, she began poking my arm repeatedly, almost like tapping out a Morse code message.
Unable to resist her persistence, I finally gave in and fed her the popcorn. Watching her cheeks puff up as she chewed made me want to grab her face and shake it out of pure affection.
Being with Eun-ha always brought out this playful, childish side of me—something I didn’t even know I had.
By the middle of the movie, I found myself watching Eun-ha’s face more than the screen. When the credits finally rolled, we exited the theater together.
“That was such a fun movie, wasn’t it?” Eun-ha chirped.
“The movie was great, but watching you eat popcorn was even better.”
“Oh, right! In the middle, when you stopped feeding me, I thought you’d fallen asleep!”
“I was curious about how you’d react if I didn’t give you any.”
“What? Seriously? And? Were you satisfied with my reaction?”
“Totally.”
“Well, as long as you enjoyed it~. Now, let’s grab some food!”
“What do you feel like eating?”
Eun-ha glanced around the area before confidently declaring, “I feel like eating… you.”
Caught off guard, I blinked at her. “Then let’s look up a good restaurant nearby and head there.”
Eun-ha stared at me intently, a mischievous glint in her eyes.
“Why are you looking at me like that?”
“I think you misunderstood me, Han-gyeol.”
“You meant you want to eat wherever I want to go—oh!”
“Yup! What you’re thinking now is correct. I want to eat you.”
“Are you a predator?”
“Rawr!”
I should’ve noticed when she was glancing around earlier.
Still, I felt the same way she did.
“Well then, let’s go quickly.”
“Alright~!”
Even though Eun-ha claimed she’d devour me, tonight I was the one who planned to take charge.
****
When we got home, I wasted no time fulfilling her bold declaration.
After a passionate and fiery moment together, Eun-ha lay under the covers, pulling the blanket up to her chin as she gazed straight into my eyes.
“Han-gyeol… you pervert…!”
“Unfair! You were the one who said you wanted to eat me first.”
“You’ve gotten… intense… since you started working out!”
“Was it too much?”
I had put in a bit more effort than usual. Worried that I might’ve overdone it, I hesitated, but Eun-ha softly mumbled under her breath:
“It was… good…”
“What? Really? Here I was, worrying for nothing.”
“Even an intense Han-gyeol feels good…! You kept saying your muscles weren’t growing, but that was a total lie…! You were so... intense...”
“I’ll take that as a compliment~.”
“Hold me already.”
“Come here.”
Eun-ha snuggled into my arms, burying herself against me.
“Are your muscles bigger because of your workouts?”
She poked at my chest and stomach with her finger, her curiosity seemingly endless.
“Eun-ha, you’re going to poke a hole in me.”
“It’s just so fascinating! You’re so firm.”
“That’s because I’m flexing right now.”
“Oh, really? Let’s see—relax for a moment!”
“No way. I’ll get all squishy.”
“Just once~! Please?”
Her playful whining made me chuckle, and for a moment, I let my guard down. She took that opportunity to jab her finger into my stomach, her fingertip sinking slightly into the soft flesh. Her eyes sparkled with delight as she laughed.
“Hehe.”
“Is this that fun for you?”
“Touching Han-gyeol’s body is the best~. I want to do it every day.”
“I’ll let you touch me as much as you want next year, so hang in there until then.”
“You better keep that promise! I’m going to poke and prod you all the time.”
“Can I take it back now?”
“Too late~.”
Eun-ha smiled brightly and leaned in to plant a kiss on my cheek.
“Han-gyeol, aren’t you hungry?”
“I am, but I’m too drained to cook after all that effort.”
“Same here. Should we order delivery?”
“Sounds good. What do you feel like eating?”
“Hm… raw beef tartare!”
“You really are a predator, huh?”
“I’m always a predator when it comes to you, Han-gyeol~. Oh, I should get dressed first. Turn around.”
“Can’t I peek?”
“You can sneak a glance~.”
Eun-ha carefully got out of bed and started putting on some clothes. She slipped into a white shirt, which looked comically oversized on her.
Wait a second—that’s my shirt.
“Han-gyeo, look at this~! Your shirt is huge! Look how the sleeves just hang down—don’t I look like one of those balloon figures they have at events?”
Eun-ha twirled her sleeves playfully, spinning them in little circles with a bright smile on her face. She looked unbelievably adorable and yet... strangely seductive at the same time.
How could she make something as simple as wearing my shirt look so alluring?
“Eun-ha, come here. Right now.”
“Huh? Why? Why are you calling me~?”
She tiptoed toward me, her every step brimming with innocence. The moment she was within reach, I grabbed her and pulled her into my arms.
“Ah—!”
I hugged her tightly, causing her to fall onto the bed, giggling.
“Why, Han-gyeol? Didn’t you already get enough of me earlier?”
“I’m just wondering—was my shirt always this provocative? Did you do this on purpose?”
“I thought you’d like it, so I tried it on. Looks like I was right~.”
“You were. To be honest, you look incredibly sexy in it.”
“Really? I like wearing your shirt too. It smells just like you. It makes me feel happy.”
Eun-ha brought the fabric of my shirt up to her nose, taking in its scent. I couldn’t help myself—I slipped my hand under the shirt.
“Eun-ha, are you really hungry right now?”
“If I say I’m starving, will you stop?”
“I can try...”
Eun-ha broke into a mischievous smile and leaned in, pressing her lips against mine.
“What about now? If I kiss you like this, will you stop? Will you?”
She started peppering my face with kisses, one after another.
“Nope. Pretty sure I can’t stop now.”
“Well... I am a little hungry, but...”
“Then let’s order food firs—”
“No, no, no. You’re hungrier. So—”
Eun-ha smiled shyly, her cheeks flushed, as she looked up at me.
“—This time, I want to devour you. Is that okay?”
“Go ahead. Devour me all you want.”
“Hehe. Thank you for the meal~.”
With those words, she leaned in and claimed my lips again.
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 151: Corporal
chapters.content:
Life in the military has become something I’ve grown used to.
Though, to be honest, it’s less about adapting to military life and more about accepting the fact that I’ve enlisted for the second time.
I was working on the daily tasks assigned to the support team when the phone rang.
Since my junior colleague had gone to handle delivery duties, I picked up the call.
“Communications security. Corporal Han-gyeol from the support team speaking.”
“Hey, it’s Sergeant Jung Dong-hyuk from the communications squad.”
“Jung Dong-hyuk .”
“Han-gyeol, did you make corporal?”
“Yes, I got promoted last Friday.”
“Oh~ So you’re discharging this year?”I couldn’t help but feel a faint twitch under my eye.
Well, they say the true beginning of one’s time in the Air Force starts at sergeant, so it’s not entirely wrong.
“Unfortunately, I still have over a year left. What’s the reason for your call?”
“I need you to approve my leave request. I’ve got to apply for TMO today.”
“Understood. I’ll take care of it right away.”
“Thanks~ See you later in the supply room.”
“Yes, Jung Dong-hyuk .”
As I hung up the phone, Master Sergeant Han, who oversees personnel, spoke to me.
“Who asked for leave approval?”
“Sergeant Jung Dong-hyuk from the communications squad. He needed it approved for his TMO application. I’ll log in and approve it right away.”
“Alright. Oh, by the way, when are they giving out the travel allowances? End of June?”
“According to Staff Sergeant Lee, it’ll be distributed in early June.”
“Got it.”
Though I enlisted as a financial soldier, I’m practically doing administrative work.
After all, no one would entrust a unit’s finances entirely to a private, so my workload is relatively light.
At that moment, my junior, who is the actual administrative soldier, returned from his delivery task.
“I’m back. Did I miss any calls?”
“Sergeant Jung Dong-hyuk called to ask for leave approval.”
“I’ll distribute the packages I just picked up, then take care of the approval myself.”
“It’s fine. I’ve already done it. By the way, did any of my packages arrive?”
“Did you order a reference book? A heavy one came in.”
“Ah, yes. Set it aside for me.”
“Understood.”
I processed the leave approval mentioned by Sergeant Jung Dong-hyuk while my junior made calls to other departments to notify them of their packages.
Once the delivery tasks were wrapped up, it was time for lunch.
The officers headed to the cafeteria first, and my junior and I followed soon after.
“Corporal Han-gyeol, are you not taking the tax accountant exam this year?”
“No, I plan to take it next year.”
“But you study every evening, even on weekends. Wouldn’t it be better to attempt it now?”
“The registration period has already passed. You should also work on getting some certifications while in the military.”
“I’ll try my best.”
“What’s for lunch today?”
“Oxtail soup with spicy squid salad.”
Oh, not bad.
“Do you want seconds?”
“That was my plan from the start. I’m heading to the base exchange after lunch. Do you need anything?”
“No, I’ll come with you.”
“Alright, sounds good.”
****
After the morning and afternoon duties, it was time for physical training.
I grabbed the straps I had prepared and headed to the gym, where Sergeant Jung Dong-hyuk greeted me.
We’d been working out together in the gym since my private first class days.
“What’s the plan for today?”
“Today’s back day for me. Aren’t you doing upper body today?”
“Yeah. Later, help me out with the bench press. I’m planning to add 5KG plates on each side. If I yell for help, you better save me.”
“Do you trust me?”
Sergeant Jung’s pupils widened at my joke.
“I’ve been treating you so damn well…”
“It’s a joke. Are we starting with the bench press right away?”
“Of course. Just don’t let me die, okay?”
“I won’t let you. Go ahead.”
After loading plates onto both sides of the barbell, I helped him through his workout.
Around the eighth rep, his arms began to tremble.
“Grrr…!”
I quickly grabbed the bar with one hand to assist him.
“Just push through two more reps. I’ve got you. One… two…”
With a clatter, the barbell was racked, and Sergeant Jung Dong-hyuk sat up, breathing heavily.
“That’s it. Let’s take off the 5KG plates.”
“When I was a private, you said removing weights mid-set was something only weaklings do.”
“Sh*t… I have no comeback for that. Are you turning into a total gym rat?”
“It’s all thanks to you, Sergeant.”
“You’ve rested enough. Get back on the bench.”
“This little…!”
After Sergeant Jung finished his bench press, he helped me with my workout.
I loaded plates onto both sides of the barbell, braced my core, and lifted.
“Hoo-!”
“Good…! Tighten your back more!”
After completing two sets, I lowered the barbell and sat down, but Sergeant Jung brought over two more plates.
“You need to load up more weight too.”
“Ah… this is already my limit. If I add more, I’m going to black out.”
“If that happens, I’ll catch you in the most epic way possible. Now lift.”
“I trust you, Sergeant Jung.”
“You trust me?”
He twisted my words like that. What a sly guy.
“Actually, let’s leave the heavier weights for later…”
“Okay, fine. I’m joking. Want me to load the plates?”
“Thank you.”
In the end, I added one more plate to each side and began deadlifts.
I managed to lift the barbell but couldn’t reach my usual number of reps.
As my strength started to drain and I considered giving up, Sergeant Jung shouted:
“Keep going! More! You can do it!”
“Grrr…!”
“Think of your parents, who raised you! Imagine this weight is their burden and lift it!”
This guy is unbelievable…
I’m dying here…!
“Don’t you want to show your girlfriend those gains?”
I do want to show her, but…!
“Then lift it!”
“Raaah…!”
“Good! Just a little more—straighten your legs! Let’s go!”
Thinking of my parents and Eun-ha, I mustered the strength to lift the barbell fully.
Then I set it down and collapsed onto the floor.
“Han-gyeol, that was badass…”
“…I thought I was going to die.”
“There are still two sets left. Get up!”
“It hasn’t even been a minute…”
“Get up. Today, I’m wrecking your back.”
God, this is so exhausting.
****
At six o’clock, I returned to the barracks and retrieved my phone.
The first thing I always do after turning it on is call Eun-ha.
After a few rings, her voice came through the line.
-“Hello~”
“Hey. Have you eaten yet?”
-“Not yet…! I’ve got assignments to finish, so I’ll eat later. Is it okay if we talk from 8:30 to 9:30 today? I’ll be working on my assignment and then eating with my friends in a bit.”
“Sure, no problem. Call me then, okay?”
-“Yup, I will. See you later~”
“Alright~”
This is how it always goes with Eun-ha—we decide when to talk, and then I get on with my tasks.
I pulled out my tablet and books from my locker and went to study.
With the first round of the tax accountant exam coming up next year, I made sure to study a little every day.
In the unit, there were others like me preparing for professional certifications, and some were even studying for college entrance exams.
I quietly settled in my spot and started studying.
I was deep into my lecture when my phone rang—it was Eun-ha.
I stepped into the hallway to answer the call.
-“Han-gyeol~ I just got home! Were you studying?”
“Yeah, I think I’ve finished today’s portion. What about you? How was your day?”
-“I wish I had something fun to share, but it’s the same as yesterday. Assignments are killing me. There’s so much more now that I’m in my second year.”
“Isn’t the college festival coming up soon?”
-“Yeah, I’m helping out here and there. I wish you could come out on leave so we could enjoy it together. It’s such a shame.”
“Yeah, unfortunately, it overlaps with my training period, so I can’t take leave.”
-“This year’s festival host is the same one from last year!”
“Just don’t end up volunteering again and getting dragged to the front!”
At my teasing, Eun-ha’s laughter bubbled through the phone.
-“Should I go up and declare in front of everyone that I’m dating you?”
“Don’t you dare. I want to quietly blend in when I return to campus.”
-“Hehe. Got it. Oh—so, how does it feel to be a corporal now? Any changes?”
“Not really. The only difference is that I’ve got three stripes on my badge now.”
-“I want to see you as Corporal Han-gyeol soon~!”
“I’ll be on leave early next month. You can see me then.”
These moments, talking to Eun-ha at the end of the hallway, were the highlight of my day.
I couldn’t wait to be discharged so I could spend my days with her, enjoying campus life together. But for now, that day seemed far away.
-“No! I’m visiting this weekend!”
“You came two weeks ago! Isn’t coming so often tiring?”
-“No way! Just the thought of going to see you makes me excited. I’m not tired at all, really!”
“Thanks for saying that. Are you coming Saturday?”
-“Yup! Do you want me to bring anything? I can pack something for you!”
“Just you coming is enough.”
-“Hehe. Got it!”
Even though I couldn’t always be with Eun-ha, I didn’t feel lonely.
Every day, she shared her life with me and asked about mine.
Even when there wasn’t anything special to talk about, she would listen to my routine like it was the first time hearing it and respond with genuine enthusiasm.
And for my sake, Eun-ha always told me every detail of her day, no matter how small.
“Eun-ha.”
-“Yeah, what is it, Han-gyeol?”
I glanced around and lowered my voice.
“I love you.”
-“Hehe~ Are you sure no one’s around?”
“I checked before saying it~”
-“I love you too, Han-gyeol. So, so much. My face is totally red right now.”
“Now I want to see it. Send me a picture.”
-“Okay, wait a sec~”
A few moments later, I received a message from Eun-ha.
Her bright smile lit up the photo, and her cheeks were just slightly flushed.
“You’re beautiful.”
-“What?”
“I said, you’re so beautiful it’s killing me~”
Ah, I really can’t wait to get discharged.
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 152: Sergeant (1)
chapters.content:
With about three weeks left until Han-gyeol’s discharge, tomorrow marks the day of his final leave before completing his military service.
Looking back now, it feels like the time flew by without me even realizing it, as if I wasn’t really counting down the days. Maybe because I didn’t feel obligated to, or perhaps because both of us stayed so busy?
I spent my days juggling college and work, staying occupied to the point of exhaustion. Perhaps I was trying to live too diligently.
The editing work I took on to distract myself from missing Han-gyeol ended up being quite profitable. I had saved enough money to buy a decent second-hand car.
Staying home most of the time—since I’m naturally a homebody—meant my expenses were minimal, especially with Han-gyeol not around.
Should I just buy him a car and propose on the spot? Hmm... no, that might be a bit too overwhelming. Let’s skip that.
Maybe I’ll buy him a new computer since he loves them. But then again, he’d probably get better value for money if he picked it out himself.
For now, maybe I’ll just save the money for our wedding in the future. Still, I really want to get him a discharge gift… but what?
***
“Eun-ha, what are you thinking so hard about?”“Huh? Oh, I’m just deciding on a discharge gift for my boyfriend,” I replied, looking up at Jiyoung, who was sitting with me in the project room.
“Why not go with something simple, like a wallet?” she suggested.
“I’ve already given him one before, so I’d rather not repeat that. Hey, Jiyoung, can I ask you something?”
“Sure, what is it?”
“What do you think about getting him a car as a discharge gift?”
“Too much. Don’t even think about it,” she said firmly.
“Yeah… I figured as much,” I muttered, deflated.
Even after asking Jiyoung, I still couldn’t come up with anything.
“Still, Eun-ha, your boyfriend is about to be discharged, huh? Time flies, doesn’t it?”
“Hmm? Not really. Waiting wasn’t that hard for me. I’m sure it was much tougher on Han-gyeol.”
“That’s so like you to say. Are you happy he’s getting discharged?”
“Of course! Now we can spend every day together again!” I exclaimed with a grin.
Han-gyeol’s discharge meant the start of us living together again. From the next semester, we’d even be attending the same college.
“But Eun-ha, you only have one semester left, right? Why not graduate early?”
“Ugh—about that…” I trailed off.
Over the past year and nine months, I’d taken every class I could, including intensive courses during every break. Technically, I could fulfill my graduation requirements by taking just a few more classes next semester.
But I wanted to spend an extra year at college with Han-gyeol.
“Spending another year in school with your boyfriend sounds nice, but wouldn’t it also be good to graduate early and start working?” Jiyoung pointed out.
“Yeah… but if I graduate early, I’ll only have one semester with Han-gyeol, and I want more time with him.”
“Fair enough. It’s up to you,” she said with a shrug. “Don’t stress too much about it.”
“Thanks for understanding,” I said warmly.
As we continued chatting, Yoori walked into the project room, her face clouded with gloom.
“I’m here…” she muttered, dragging her feet.
“What took you so long?” Jiyoung asked.
“I was having dinner with my boyfriend,” Yoori replied as she flopped onto the sofa.
“Then why do you look so down? Did you guys fight?”
“My boyfriend just told me he’s enlisting next semester,” Yoori groaned.
“Ah—” Jiyoung and I both exclaimed in sympathy.
It seemed Yoori was about to take on the role of a military girlfriend, a baton I had just carried.
“Eun-ha,” Yoor called out.
“Y-Yeah?”
“Give me some tips…!” she pleaded desperately.
“Tips? Uh… do I even have any? Haha…” I laughed awkwardly.
Yoori suddenly sat up straight and poured out her frustration.
“My boyfriend is enlisting right after finishing his second try at college exams! Why couldn’t he wait a little longer?”
“One military girlfriend retires, and another one steps up,” Jiyoung remarked with a wry smile.
“Wait, is your boyfriend getting discharged soon, Eun-ha?” Yoori asked.
“Um… should I even say that here?” I hesitated.
“It’s fine! Happy news deserves celebration,” Yoori said earnestly.
“Okay then. He’s getting discharged next month. Time really flew! Even though Han-gyeol served three extra months in the Air Force, I managed just fine. You’ll do great too, Yoori.”
“Thanks for the encouragement,” she said, looking a little brighter. “But wasn’t it hard for you?”
“Sure, there were tough days. But if you both care for each other, it’s manageable.”
I smiled warmly, thinking back on the journey.
It wasn’t a short time by any means. There were moments when I missed Han-gyeol terribly. But I knew he felt the same way, which made it bearable.
“Still, I wouldn’t want to go through it again,” I added with a laugh.
Once he’s discharged, I’m not letting him out of my sight!
****
Ding-Dong! The doorbell rang early in the morning.
I quickly turned off the stove and rushed to greet Han-gyeol.
“Who’s there?”
“Eun-ha, it’s me! Can you open the door?”
Recognizing Han-gyeol’s voice, I immediately unlocked the front door. He walked in with a big box in his hands, smiling bashfully.
“What’s all this?”
“I picked up some stuff from the BX—moisturizers, face masks, and other things. Figured I’d stock up before discharge.”
“With this much, you should’ve called me to come out and help!”
“I’ve gotten a lot stronger than I was before enlisting. It’s fine.”
“Of course, Han-gyeol is the strongest! You haven’t eaten yet, right? Let’s organize this and eat together.”
“Thanks for always making me breakfast when I’m on leave.”
“And I’m thankful you always make me dinner when you’re home!”
Our relationship felt brighter than ever, even more than before he enlisted. I could hardly remember the stoic version of Han-gyeol anymore.
“Come inside quickly!”
“Wait a sec!”
As I turned to head back to the kitchen, Han-gyeol suddenly hugged me from behind.
“What’s this? You’re not eating?”
“Sorry. Just let me stay like this for a moment. It feels amazing knowing I’m on my last leave.”
“Okay, hold on as long as you want.”
“If I do, we might not get to eat breakfast at all.”
He rested his chin on my shoulder, gazing at me with warmth.
“No skipping breakfast! Han-gyeol, you always eat breakfast, don’t you?”
“I could just eat you instead,” he teased, his smile unusually bright today.
I guess the reality of his discharge was finally sinking in.
“No way! The soup will get cold. I’ll give you a kiss instead.”
I twisted around to face him and stood on my tiptoes, pressing my lips against his.
“Happy now?”
“Not enough.”
I kissed him again.
“How about now?”
He didn’t answer. Assuming he still wasn’t satisfied, I showered his face with kisses.
“Eun-ha, if you keep this up, I’m going to end up devoured.”
“Who cares? A little indulgence in the morning won’t hurt!”
“You’ve gotten even cooler while I was in the military, haven’t you?”
“Hehe, well, I’m just so happy that you’re about to be discharged.”
His excitement seemed to transfer to me, and I felt giddy too. I hugged his waist tightly, nuzzling my face into his chest.
“Eun-ha, if you squeeze me any harder, my waist might break. Have you been lifting weights lately?”
“Nope, this is pure love and affection. You’ll just have to endure.”
“Fair enough! Then I’ll pamper you back!”
“Ahh!”
Han-gyeol suddenly grabbed my waist and lifted me effortlessly. I didn’t expect it to be so easy for him.
“Put me down! Am I not heavy?”
“You’re light as a feather, Eun-ha. Have you lost weight?”
“To be honest, I think I’ve gained a bit…”
“No way. I can still toss you around like this.”
He playfully bounced me up and down in his arms.
“This’ll be perfect for playing with our future kids.”
Looking down at him, I couldn’t help but smile. Gosh, he’s just too adorable. I almost wanted to start making those kids right now.
“Then you won’t do this for me anymore?”
“I’ll do it for you sometimes too,” he replied with a bright smile.
“You’re having fun too, aren’t you?”
“Yeah, it feels like I’m on a ride. Are you sure I’m not heavy?”
“Well… now that you mention it, I’m starting to hit my limit.”
“See? I told you not to overdo it. Put me down already!”
He carefully set me back on the floor.
“Alright, time for breakfast! Go change and wash your hands quickly!”
“Got it!”
Han-gyeol took off his military boots and headed into the room. I stood there watching his back for a moment—his shoulders looked so broad now. He was already dependable before, but now he felt even more so, like he’d brought home a whole new level of security.
I have no idea how long he’s planning to make my heart race like this. Even more than when we first started dating, my heart felt like it could burst from my chest. But with that, my happiness had also grown proportionally.
“This is just perfect…”
I smiled as I set the breakfast table. Han-gyeol, now changed, sat down at the table and commented, “Looks like a feast as always.”
“It’s just a few side dishes and beef soup.”
“That is a feast! What do you want for dinner tonight?”
“Your spicy stir-fried pork. Can you make it?”
“Of course. Mind if I dig in right now?”
“Go ahead!”
“Thanks for the meal.”
Watching him eat so heartily made me feel full too. Han-gyeol was still as charming, adorable, and lovable as ever.
This won’t do—I’m eating him up after breakfast.
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 153: Sergeant (2)
chapters.content:
The entire barracks, where my friend was the squad leader, was pulling weeds.
It wasn’t even during work hours, so I asked my friend why they were doing it.
“Why are you pulling weeds on the day before your discharge?”
“…You know those apples we got last month?”
“Oh, you mean the apples we each got a whole box of?”
“Yeah, those. I mean, apples for breakfast, apples for lunch, apples for dinner—on top of that, they gave us another box of apples as part of the rations. It drove me crazy! The apples got squished, and juice started leaking all over the lockers. How did you deal with it?”
“I just ate them all.”
“All of them?!”
This year, there was a bumper crop of apples, so every soldier in our unit received a box.
I ate them whenever I had time, but other soldiers secretly threw them in the trash.Did they get caught doing that?
“Did you get caught throwing them in the trash?”
“No, Han-gyeol, listen to me. Do you think what I did was such a big deal?”
“So, what did you do?”
“My squad members and I secretly buried them in the mountain behind the barracks.”
I flinched for a moment at his words.
“Did you get caught?”
“No, the burying part went perfectly. But then wild deer came down to the battalion commander’s vegetable garden, and they trashed it. The commander was furious and went to hunt the deer himself. But guess what? Every time he followed the deer tracks, he found bits of apple pulp. That’s how we got caught.”
The story was so intriguing that I walked alongside him to hear more.
“That’s hilarious. At least you didn’t end up in military court.”
“I almost did. They said I violated the supply management regulations. But hey, wasn’t it more eco-friendly than just throwing them in the trash?”
Laughing so hard that I clutched my stomach, I teased him.
“It was eco-friendly, I’ll give you that. Hey, grab those weeds over there too.”
“You jerk…! Ugh, fine. In the army, it’s always the one who gets caught that’s at fault. But whatever, I’m done tomorrow, so I’ll let it slide.”
“You could end up doing another tour.”
“Don’t push it…”
“Sorry. That was a bit much.”
This should be my last time in the army, ever.
Sigh… From being a recruit to a sergeant, it’s been such a rollercoaster ride.
Still, I think I lived relatively comfortably thanks to all the good people I met here.
“By the way, isn’t your tax accountant exam this month? Aren’t you studying?”
“I’ve studied enough. Who studies on the day before discharge?”
“True. You should just get ready to get beaten up tonight.”
“I’ve been a good soldier, so I have nothing to worry about. You’re the one who’s gonna get hit.”
“We’ll see about that.”
****
“Attention! Evening roll call for Barracks 1. Total personnel: 4. No absences. Current personnel: 4. Evening roll call complete.”
“Ah, good. You guys are heading home tomorrow, right?”
“Yes, sir.”
The officer on duty glanced at me.
“Han-gyeol, you should stay and re-enlist.”
“Apologies, sir, but I have too many attachments to civilian life.”
“Or come back as a noncommissioned officer after your discharge. I’ll take care of you.”
“Apologies, sir, but I have no regrets about leaving the army.”
“Is that so? Anyway, good work, all of you. Have a safe trip home. Roll call dismissed.”
As soon as the officer left, I could hear the heavy footsteps of my juniors approaching Barracks 1.
Their murderous stares were audible even from inside the barracks.
Of course, one of my juniors walked in with a grin on his face.
“Victory! Congratulations on your discharge!”
“What?! You’re gonna beat me too? I’ve been so good to you guys.”
“Han-gyeol, we’ll give you the special treatment—wrapped in a blanket, comforter, and all.”
Hearing that, my friend protested loudly.
“Hey! Why is Han-gyeol getting special treatment?!”
“Well, he’s been good to all the juniors.”
“So, what, we haven’t been?!”
Several juniors nodded in agreement.
See? You should’ve been nicer during your service.
“Lights out~!”
I quickly wrapped myself in the blanket, comforter, and extra padding.
As the lights went out, the barracks echoed with groans and cries.
Of course, the “special treatment” directed at me was minimal, and I just lay there enjoying the sound of my friends’ suffering.
“Good job, everyone~”
“Congrats on your discharge~”
“Have a safe trip home~”
One by one, the juniors left, and the barracks grew quiet again.
“Ugh… I thought I was gonna die. Han-gyeol, you okay?”
“Me? They didn’t hit me.”
“Unbelievable. I thought I was nice enough.”
“They hit you as a congratulatory gesture. Does it hurt a lot?”
“It’s bearable. Ha…I can’t believe I’m finally discharged. It’s only sinking in now. I thought this day would never come.”
“Congratulations.”
“What are you doing tomorrow? Meeting your girlfriend right away?”
“Yeah. I have to. I also need to give her a ring.”
We’d been dating this whole time without getting matching rings, so I finally bought one.
She’d probably like the ring more than flowers, though she’d love both.
I was already excited imagining Eun-Ha’s reaction.
“Man… Your girlfriend is actually waiting for you.”
“Ha… I just want to marry her already.”
“Seriously? How are you gonna get married at 22?”
“Who knows~ If I do, I’ll send you a wedding invitation.”
“Sure thing. Ugh, let’s get some sleep. I just want to go home already.”
“Yeah. Goodnight~”
And so, the second chapter of my life in the army came to an end.
****
“Victory! Reporting! Sergeant Lee Han-gyeol and three others have officially been discharged from the Republic of Korea Air Force as of today. Reporting, sir! Victory!”
“Alright. Don’t get too carried away celebrating today. You’ve all worked hard. I won’t say much. Stay healthy out there. Dismissed!”
Following the Personnel Officer’s command, we saluted for the last time.
“Attention, unit! Salute the Battalion Commander!”
“Victory!”
“Victory.”
The Battalion Commander returned the salute with a kind smile, a rare sight for the day.
“At ease. This concludes the discharge ceremony.”
Once the ceremony ended, I boarded the bus heading out of the base.
Our juniors waved us off along the way, and I climbed aboard with a happy smile.
As I looked out the window at the barracks for the last time, I etched the scene into my memory, officially ending my military life.
“Take care! See you later!”
“Yeah, stay in touch! Safe travels!”
After arriving at the terminal, I bid my friends farewell and headed straight home.
Even though this was my second discharge, I couldn’t stop the corners of my lips from curling upwards.
With light steps, I hopped into a taxi to make my way home.
Taking the stairs two at a time, I reached the front door and punched in the code on the door lock.
I was so eager to see Eun-ha that I swung the door open, but it stopped midway because of the safety latch.
Hearing the rattling sound, Eun-ha came toward the door.
“Han-Gyeol?! Are you back?!”
“Yeah, yeah, Eun-ha! I’m home.”
“Wait a second~!”
She closed the door momentarily to unlatch the safety chain, and when it opened again, she stood there with a radiant smile.
Overcome with joy, I immediately pulled her into a tight hug.
“Eun-ha, I’m discharged!”
“Yeah, yeah! You’ve worked so hard! You really did!”
“Ha… Thinking about how I can spend every day with you now makes me so happy.”
I hugged her even tighter.
“Me too. I’m so happy. Let’s never be apart again!”
“Yeah, I promise. We’ll stay together every single day.”
“I’m so glad you’re finally discharged.”
She snuggled deeper into my arms, and as our eyes met, we shared a kiss.
“Hehe.”
“Eun-ha, you seem happier than I am~?”
“Maybe I am~? Ah, just thinking about sleeping next to you every night now makes me so happy.”
“I feel the same, waking up next to you every morning.”
“Exactly! You’re not going anywhere now~”
“I’m not. I promise.”
“Come in quickly! I’ll help you unpack~”
“Hold on~”
As our hug ended, I carefully reached into my pocket and pulled out a small box.
When she saw it, Eun-ha’s eyes widened in surprise. Feeling shy, I slowly opened the box.
“What’s this?”
It was my first time giving a ring to a woman.
I was nervous and embarrassed, but for Eun-ha, there was nothing I wouldn’t do.
I’d rehearsed what to say in my head for days, but now, I couldn’t remember a word.
No matter—I just had to speak from the heart.
“Eun-ha, thank you for waiting for me. I love you.”
Her eyes welled up with tears at my heartfelt words.
Though she was smiling happily, tears began streaming down her face.
“It took way too long for us to get couple rings.”
I gently took her left hand, lifting it slowly and carefully, and slid the ring onto her ring finger.
“I spent so much time choosing, but I’m not sure if you’ll like the design—”
Before I could finish, Eun-ha threw her arms around me again.
“It’s beautiful! I love it so much! I’m so happy!”
“Really? That’s a relief. I was so worried about it.”
“Thank you—for coming back safe and sound, and for this amazing gift!”
Through her tears, she thanked me again and again.
“Alright, stop crying! It’s not like I’m leaving for basic training today!”
“I love you, Han-gyeol. I really love you.”
“I love you too. But hey, you still have to put my ring on me.”
Without missing a beat, she pulled away and slid the ring onto my finger.
Grasping my hand in hers, she beamed with joy.
“It looks so good!”
“I’m glad you’re happy.”
“Yeah, I’m overjoyed! Are you hungry?”
She asked with a bright smile.
“Not for food.”
“Then?”
“I’m starving for you, Eun-ha.”
At my words, she leaned in and pressed her lips to mine.
“Then hurry up and devour me.”
“Don’t mind if I do~”
From now on, we’d never be apart.
“Han-gyeol, come here quickly~”
“I’m on my way~”
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 154: Huh? (1)
chapters.content:
Finally, Han-gyeol completed his military service.
After his discharge, the first thing we did was visit both sets of parents to greet them again. Both my parents and Han-gyeol’s parents praised and congratulated us, saying we had worked hard.
Afterward, we met up with Harim and Jang Yujin for drinks, and we also made time to meet other people we had to see. Once we finished meeting everyone, I didn’t part from Han-gyeol for even a moment.
From waking up in bed in the morning to falling asleep at night, I stuck to him like glue.
We did everything together—laundry, grocery shopping, and cooking meals. We made up for all the things we couldn’t do while Han-gyeol was in the military. We never parted.
Though a bit embarrassing, we also made up for all the missed physical affection. Thanks to his consistent workouts, Han-gyeol’s stamina had improved, and… every day was just... hehe.
I’m already wondering if the nights we’ll spend in Jeju Island, where we’re headed now, will be just as fiery. Every single day, without fail. The thought alone makes my heart race.
“Hehe… Just thinking about it makes me happy.”
“Eun-ha, what are you daydreaming about like that?”
“About being with Han-gyeol every night.”“Eun-ha, you don’t have a filter anymore, do you?”
“So what? It’s just the two of us~”
Even though I’m like this, I do know when and where to draw the line.
“True. It’s just the two of us~ Come here.”
“Okay!”
When Han-gyeol opened his arms, I dove straight into them.
Ever since his discharge, he’s been openly expressing his affection for me even more. I guess he also wanted to be lovey-dovey, just like me. Realizing we felt the same made me so happy.
“Let’s have lots of fun in Jeju Island.”
“As long as I’m with you, I’m fine with anything.”
“Same here~ Let’s go eat something delicious.”
“Black pork! And also gukbap noodles!”
“Sure. Let’s eat everything~ But first, let’s head to the gate for our flight.”
“Yep! Let’s go!”
Hand in hand, Han-gyeol and I walked to the gate.
Even after sitting down on the plane, we didn’t let go of each other’s hands.
“You know, this might be a weird time to ask, but you have your second exam next month. Are you sure it’s okay to be traveling?”
“It’s rare for people to pass everything in one go anyway. I studied, of course, but honestly, I don’t feel too confident. I was planning to focus harder on next year’s exam. So, don’t worry—I didn’t push myself to come.”
“Okay, I trust you. You always manage things well. But still, if there’s anything I can help with, just let me know.”
“You’re already helping a lot, you know. Bringing me fruit while I study~”
“Ah, it makes me feel like a wife. I kind of like it~”
I grinned brightly as I spoke.
“It felt new to me too, like I was being cared for as a husband.”
“I’ll peel them for you often~ And I’ll peel mandarins for you in Jeju Island too!”
“You’re spoiling me too much. Let me do something for you too.”
“Alright, then you can peel them for me. Hehe.”
“You’re too cute. Let’s have lots of fun.”
“Yes, let’s have so much fun! And take lots of photos.”
Before long, the plane took off, and about an hour later, we arrived at Jeju Airport.
As soon as we stepped out of the gate, palm trees greeted us warmly.
Jeju Island was a place Han-gyeol had wanted to visit before his enlistment, and we finally made it.
We were steadily fulfilling all the dreams we had envisioned together.
“Palm trees…!”
“Eun-ha, you look so excited~ Let’s go rent a car quickly.”
“Rent a car…! Let’s go!”
Back when I was twenty, it had been a bit tricky to rent a car since I hadn’t had my license for a full year. But now, it was no problem.
I suggested public transportation would be fine, but Han-gyeol insisted on renting a car, saying he knew how to drive.
Though I agreed, my parents were initially against it.
They worried it’d be dangerous since he didn’t have much driving experience. But after he took them on a drive to Yeongjongdo to demonstrate his skills, they finally gave their permission.
Honestly, there’s nothing Han-gyeol can’t do.
“Is there anything you can’t do, Han-gyeol?”
“Huh? What brought that up?”
“Well, you even know how to drive, even though you weren’t a military driver~”
“Guess I’ve got a knack for it.”
“You’re so cool.”
“And you’re so pretty, Eun-ha. Ah, there’s our car.”
Like a pro, Han-gyeol started taking photos and videos of every corner of the rental car.
“Why are you taking pictures?”
“To document any scratches or dents that were already here. That way, we won’t be blamed when we return it.”
“Ah, smart.”
“Though it’s not too strict here since we can just return the car and leave. But better safe than sorry. All done—let’s get in.”
“Yep!”
Sitting in the car with just the two of us felt fresh and exciting. It was our first time alone in a car, and the new experience made the corners of my mouth twitch up.
No, I had to hold it in. It’d be embarrassing to grin like a kid just because I was sitting in a car.
“Eun-ha, you’re grinning so much.”
“Ugh—was I that obvious?”
“You’re adorable. Alright, time to buckle up~”
Leaning in, Han-gyeol gently pulled my seatbelt across me.
With a click, he fastened it and flashed me a bright smile before settling back into his seat.
Sometimes, he’s so sly it drives me crazy. My heart was about to burst.
Noticing my flustered expression, he teased me.
“Eun-ha, your face is bright red. So, this works, huh?”
“You little fox…”
“It’s been a while since I’ve seen you so embarrassed. I like it.”
With an innocent smile, he radiated mischief, and I decided to retaliate.
Unfastening my seatbelt with a click, I leaned forward.
“Why are you unbuckling your seatbelt?”
“To make you blush just as much.”
“Huh? What do you me—mmph!”
I leaned in and pressed my lips against his, slipping my tongue into his mouth.
By now, I knew exactly what kind of kiss he liked.
Stealing his breath away, I slowly pulled back, leaving a thin, white thread between us.
“Now… we’re even, right?”
As I smiled, Han-gyeol mumbled softly.
“You little fox…”
****
After dropping off our luggage at the accommodation, Han-gyeol and I went out for lunch together.
The sizzling sound of Jeju black pork filled the air, and as always, Han-gyeol was staring intently at the meat as it grilled. He always made that face whenever meat was cooking—it was so cute. I couldn’t help but stare at him with the same intensity.
“You can eat now~”
“Thank you.”
The moment the staff spoke, Han-gyeol eagerly grabbed his chopsticks.
I picked up the most delicious-looking piece of meat and placed it in his bowl.
He looked at me and said,
“This is the best-looking piece…?! Eun-ha, you eat it.”
“No, it’s for you. I want to see you eat it!”
At my words, the corners of his lips lifted into a gentle smile.
“I’m touched…”
His sincere gaze made me want to melt. He was just too adorable.
“Don’t get so emotional over one piece of meat~”
“It makes me feel so loved.”
“Well, I love you a lot~ Now hurry up and eat.”
“Alright, I’ll enjoy it~”
As always, the first piece of meat had to be dipped in salt.
I always wondered if today might be different, but he never skipped the salt.
This time, too, I watched his chopsticks intently as he dipped the meat into the salt and then popped it into his mouth.
I swear, it was so cute I could have died on the spot.
Living with him, I’ve come to notice so many of his little habits.
And honestly, the process of learning all these small things about him is so delightful and makes me so happy.
After swallowing his bite, he smiled brightly and placed a piece of meat in my bowl.
“Eun-ha, you try it too.”
“Is it good?”
“It melts.”
Hearing that, I looked around quickly.
It was a weekday lunch, so there weren’t as many people as I’d expected.
“Feed me.”
“Right now?”
“Yeah.”
“Alright. Open up.”
The moment I opened my mouth, he fed me the meat.
Just like he said, it melted in my mouth.
As I smiled with delight at how delicious it was, he looked at me with a satisfied expression.
“You eat so prettily.”
It felt so wonderful to be loved like this.
“Is it good?”
I nodded enthusiastically in response to his question.
After that, we ate until we were completely full.
Once we finished our meal and paid the bill, we moved straight on to our next plan.
Both of us are pretty organized people, so we had mapped out an efficient itinerary for the trip.
“Now let’s go get some tangerine tarts!”
“Sounds good. By the way, the meat here was amazing. Should we come back if we have time later?”
“Was it that good~?”
“It was unbelievable.”
“Alright! We’ll come again if we get a chance!”
“Okay, then shall we head out?”
“Yep!”
With a beep, he unlocked the car. I immediately dashed ahead of him to the car and kindly opened the driver’s side door for him.
“Han-gyeol, get in~!”
“Pfft—! Did you run all the way over just to open the door for me?”
“What do you think? Polite, huh? Are you falling for me all over again?”
He burst into laughter at my antics, holding his stomach as he laughed uncontrollably.
Seeing him laugh like that made me feel so happy.
Once he calmed down, he came over to me with a big smile.
“That’s really polite. I’m definitely falling for you.”
“Really? Just wait—I’ll make you fall for me even more. Get ready~”
“I’m falling every day.”
“Then today, I’ll make sure you fall every hour!”
“You can stop wooing me now, you know?”
“I’ll woo you forever~”
This is just so much fun.
--- The End OF The Chapter --
