chapters.title: Chapter 155: Huh? (2)
chapters.content:
We were on our way back to the lodging after finishing the day’s schedule.
Eun-ha, sitting in the passenger seat, was nodding off, clearly tired from running around all day since morning. She looked adorable as she tried to shake off her drowsiness, her head bobbing up and down.
“Eun-ha, if you’re sleepy, just take a little nap. I’ll wake you up when we arrive.”
“No way! Why do you think it’s called the passenger seat? I won’t sleep... not at all...!”
Despite Eun-ha’s wide-eyed insistence, her eyelids looked heavy.
I turned down the air conditioner a little and drove silently, and soon I could hear her breathing.
Shweeek, shweeek… The delicate sound of Eun-ha’s breaths tickled my ears, and before I knew it, the corners of my lips lifted.
She won’t last ten minutes. How cute can she get?
After driving along the coastal road and pulling into the parking lot, I stayed in the car, waiting for Eun-ha to wake up.
Carefully, I brushed her hair back and stared at her face.She’s beautiful when she smiles, beautiful when she cries, and even now, she’s breathtakingly beautiful asleep.
Her porcelain skin, long lashes, sharp nose, and lips that looked soft and rosy.
There wasn’t a single thing about Eun-ha’s face that wasn’t perfect. Just looking at her made my face heat up.
As if sensing my gaze, Eun-ha’s eyes moved slightly. I quickly returned to the driver’s seat and pretended we had just arrived.
“Eun-ha, we’re here. Time to wake up.”
“Huh...? I didn’t mean to fall asleep. Sorry.”
“Why are you apologizing for that?”
“Your car is just so comfortable, Han-gyeol.”
“Thanks for the compliment. Come on, let’s go.”
“Okay, okay.”
Eun-ha grinned as she unbuckled her seatbelt.
I got out too, and we stepped into the elevator to head up to the lodging.
As I reached to press the button for our floor, Eun-ha darted forward and pressed the button for the first floor instead.
“Aren’t we going to the room?”
“Nope. The sea is right in front of us. Let’s take a little walk first.”
“Are you sure? Aren’t you tired? We can do it tomorrow.”
“Are you tired, Han-gyeol? Then you can go up.”
“Nope, I’m fine.”
“Then let’s go now. We only get this one moment together today, after all.”
“It’s not like the world is ending tomorrow.”
“There’s a saying, you know—‘love as if today is your last.’”
Eun-ha beamed up at me with the brightest smile. Why is everything she says so sweet?
“Eun-ha, even your words are beautiful.”
“How’s my flirting? Did it work a little?”
“Yeah, you got me—multiple times today.”
“You promised to stay smitten with me forever, remember~”
Eun-ha linked arms with me, her radiant smile directed at me. Her warmth and soft presence against my arm made my face burn.
“Wow, Han-gyeol, your face is all red!”
“You’re making me want to skip the beach and go straight to the room.”
“No way~ Beach first, room later!”
Just as Eun-ha finished speaking, the elevator doors opened to the first floor.
We walked outside, the cool night breeze washing over us as we headed toward the beach.
“The night air feels so refreshing!”
“Yeah, and the breeze is nice too.”
“Should I have worn a dress?”
“Huh? Why?”
Eun-ha gave me a shy smile.
“Because I want to look pretty for you, Han-gyeol.”
“Saying you’re always beautiful might sound too cliché.”
“Not at all! I feel thrilled every time I hear it, no matter how often.”
“Ahh, you’re adorable~”
“What’s that supposed to mean? You’re treating me like a little animal.”
“Honestly, if I had to compare, you’re more of a predator than a small animal.”
“Well, you’re no pushover either, Han-gyeol.”
Eun-ha gently slipped off her shoes.
“Are you going into the water?”
“Just dipping my feet. You’re coming too, right?”
Eun-ha held her shoes in both hands as she looked at me.
“What if I say no?”
“You wouldn’t dare—I know you too well.”
“Looks like I better roll out the beach mat~”
Following Eun-ha’s lead, I took off my shoes and rolled up my pants. Together, we stepped into the cool ocean water.
“Wow, this feels amazing!”
“You really love the sea, don’t you, Eun-ha?”
“It’s not the sea—it’s being here with you, Han-gyeol. Everything’s better with you.”
“Even a pit of fire?”
“Okay, maybe not that.”
Eun-ha let out a soft giggle.
We kept walking along the beach, leaving footprints in the sand.
“How far are we going? Let’s turn back soon.”
“Let’s do that. My legs are starting to hurt too.”
“Want me to carry you?”
“What? I ate a lot today, so I’ll be heavy.”
“Eun-ha, no matter how much you weigh, it can’t be that heavy. Want me to carry you?”
“Hmm—nope. I’ll carry you instead! It’s been a while since I gave you a piggyback ride!”
“I’m heavier now; it’ll be tough.”
“I’ve gotten stronger too! Come on, hop on!”
Eun-ha confidently turned her back toward me, inviting me to climb on.
Half doubting, I climbed onto her back.
“Ugh…! I can do this.”
“Oh… you’re holding on better than I expected.”
“I’ll carry you all the way—waah!”
Eun-ha lost her balance while carrying me.
Suddenly, she tipped over, and we both tumbled onto the sand.
A wave rolled in and soaked my clothes before receding, leaving me drenched.
Eun-ha stared at me with wide eyes, shocked.
“Oh no.”
“Eun-ha, since it’s come to this, maybe you should—”
Before I could finish my sentence, Eun-ha bolted, running away from me.
“Hey, where are you going!”
“You’re going to dunk me in the water!”
Smart. She knew my intentions, but that’s to be expected after dating so long.
Still…! I kicked off my shoes onto the sand and ran after her.
“Stay right there!”
“Kyaaah! I’m sorry!”
Eun-ha ran for her life.
Did she train for track and field when I wasn’t looking? How is she so fast?
Just as I was about to give up and slow down—
“Ah—!”
Eun-ha tripped over her own feet and fell onto the beach.
“Oh no.”
****
In the end, we returned to the lodging covered in sand and took a shower together.
But I couldn’t stop replaying the image of Eun-ha tripping over her own feet in my mind.
“Han-gyeol… stop laughing…!”
“Am I laughing right now?”
“You’re laughing a lot!”
“At least you didn’t get hurt.”
“My pride got hurt…”
For some reason, everything Eun-ha said today was hilariously funny.
Even though I tried to hold it in, the corners of my lips kept twitching upward.
In the end, Eun-ha grabbed my cheeks.
“Really… Is it that funny to see your girlfriend fall over?”
“Sorry… you were just too cute—”
“Fine, I’ll forgive you because I’m cute…!”
Eun-ha looked down at me with a pout.
“Are you really sure you didn’t hurt yourself?”
“Yeah. My clothes just got wet, that’s all.”
“Are you mad?”
“No, just embarrassed. Come here so I can dry your hair.”
“I can dry it myself, you know?”
“Just come here already.”
She seemed so flustered that she wouldn’t meet my gaze.
Sensing her embarrassment, I turned around and sat with my back to her.
Eun-ha began patting my wet hair with a towel, then grabbed the hairdryer.
“Let me know if it gets too hot.”
“Okay. I’m counting on you.”
Vrrrrr— The hairdryer buzzed softly as Eun-ha carefully dried my hair.
When she was done, she wrapped her arms around me from behind.
“What’s this? Isn’t it my turn to dry your hair now?”
“Just… forget about me falling earlier. It’s so embarrassing.”
“Alright. If I turn around, I’ll pretend it never happened.”
“Ugh… I fell so clumsily too…!”
“Honestly, it was kind of cute.”
“Ugh… don’t call things like that cute!”
Eun-ha rubbed her face against my back.
“Promise me you won’t tease me about it anymore?”
“I promise. I won’t do anything you don’t like.”
“Thanks…”
“Now, can you let me see your face?”
Eun-ha quietly stepped away from me.
When I turned around to look at her face, I saw that her cheeks were burning bright red.
She looked so adorable that I couldn’t help but pull her into my arms.
“But my hair isn’t dry yet…”
“I’m hugging you because you’re too cute to resist.”
“I feel like I show this childish side of myself to you way too often.”
“You do?”
Eun-ha spoke in a slightly sullen tone.
“Yeah. I want to be the kind of mature woman you can lean on, Han-gyeol.”
Her words carried a hint of frustration, and I froze for a moment.
I hadn’t realized she felt this way.
Meeting her gaze, I softly replied.
“Honestly, I think you’re incredibly mature, Eun-ha.”
“You’re just saying that to make me feel better, aren’t you?”
“No, I really mean it. I’ve thought that about you for a long time.”
“Really? In what way? Be specific.”
“Nothing comes to mind immediately, but… you’re always so thoughtful. You plan things carefully, take responsibility, and think deeply about everything.”
“But I learned all of that from you, Han-gyeol!”
“That’s not true. Hmm… for example, do you remember what you told me before I went to the military?”
“What did I say?”
Eun-ha tilted her head, curious.
“You told me not to feel obligated.”
“Oh—yeah, I remember. Why?”
“You might not realize it, but that was such a mature thing to say. Honestly, it takes a lot of courage to say something like that. When I heard it, I thought, ‘Wow, Eun-ha is so grown-up.’ And honestly, I’ve never really thought of you as childish.”
At my words, a slow smile spread across Eun-ha’s face.
She seemed happy to hear the compliment.
“Hehe… so that’s what you thought.”
“Yeah. And I rely on you a lot, Eun-ha. When I’m having a hard time, you’re the first person I think of.”
“Really? If anything tough happens, you have to lean on me, okay? Your Noona here will take care of everything! Just trust me!”
Eun-ha declared confidently, brimming with pride.
“Still, don’t stop showing me this cute side of you every now and then. I love mature Eun-ha, but I love cute Eun-ha too.”
“Okay, okay! I’ll make sure to do that!”
“Feeling better now?”
“Yep!”
“...”
Looking at Eun-ha like this, I found her both adorable and incredibly dependable.
“In that case, Noona is going to devour you today.”
“Excuse me?”
“I love you.”
“Wha—ack—!”
Eun-ha suddenly pushed me over, pinning me to the floor.
Then she climbed on top of me, tying her hair back with slow, deliberate movements.
“Han-gyeol, you’re staying still today.”
How did things escalate like this?
Well, I guess it doesn’t really matter. Even this side of Eun-ha is too adorable to resist.
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 156: Huh? (3)
chapters.content:
Han-gyeol and I were sitting alone on the beach, waiting for the sunrise.
No matter how much we looked around, there wasn’t a single person in sight.
It felt as if everyone had cleared the area just for us.
Maybe, as a group, they decided to avoid this spot for our sake.
“Han-gyeol, it feels like we’ve rented out the whole beach!”“Right? With no one around, I feel so good, too…”
Sitting here with Han-gyeol, just the two of us, made me incredibly happy.
As we listened to the gentle crashing of the waves, we waited for the sun to rise.
Why did this feel more exciting than when we watched the sunrise in Gangneung?
My heart was beating faster than usual, and I could feel my pulse quickening.
“It must be because I love you even more than back then~”
As if Han-gyeol had read my thoughts, he answered immediately.
“Huh?! How did you know what I was thinking?!”
“Because there’s nothing about Eun-ha that I don’t know~ I can tell everything just by looking at your face.”
It was amazing…!
How could he read me so accurately?
Does love make telepathy possible?
“Eun-ha.”
“Yeah?”
“Because of you, I’m so happy. I think I might be the happiest person in the world.”
“Really~? Tell me, when are you the happiest?”
“It’s hard to pick a specific moment. I’m just always happy. Just having you by my side is more than enough.”
“Then I’ll make you even happier from now on.”
“No, I’ll make you happier, Eun-ha.”
“I’m already super happy right now~ Hehe.”
When I laughed, Han-gyeol looked at me lovingly.
“Why are you so beautiful?”
“To get all of Han-gyeol’s love!”
“Yeah. I’ll love you more and more every day.”
He gently ruffled my hair.
That touch always made me feel good.
It was warm, and it filled my heart with joy.
“I feel like I could do anything for Eun-ha.”
“Really~? Then bring me the sun that’s about to rise.”
“Sure. How hard could that be?”
“What~? You’d even pluck the sun for me?”
“Of course. How hard could it be~?”
Han-gyeol replied with such a relaxed expression, as if he truly meant it.
Was it a metaphor?
Or did he have another way to “pluck” the sun?
“Is that even possible?”
When I asked again, Han-gyeol nodded confidently.
“How?”
I tilted my head in curiosity, and Han-gyeol pointed toward the sea.
“First, we have to wait for the sun to rise.”
“Oh, yeah. That makes sense, right?”
“Eun-ha, if I bring you the sun, what will you give me in return?”
“Hmm~ Then I’ll bring you the moon next time!”
I answered brightly, but I still had no idea how he planned to pluck the sun.
I couldn’t even guess.
“That sounds great. Oh? Look, the sun is rising. Eun-ha, look quickly.”
Following the direction of Han-gyeol’s pointing finger, I turned my gaze.
The sun was rising from below the horizon.
Its warm rays wrapped around Han-gyeol and me as it fully emerged.
I shifted my gaze from the sun to Han-gyeol.
“The sun’s up now, so pluck it for me.”
“Okay, watch closely~”
Han-gyeol slowly stretched his arm toward the sea.
Then, gently, as if handling something fragile, he reached out and grasped the sun.
So this is how he meant to “pluck” it.
As expected, the real sun—
“Got it.”
“Huh?”
When Han-gyeol fully clasped his hand, the sun, which had been floating above the horizon, disappeared.
Startled, I jumped up from the beach in shock.
“What?! Where did the sun go?”
“Huh? You asked me to pluck it, didn’t you? It’s in my hand.”
“No… Han-gyeol? What are you even saying…?! Wait, what’s happening to your hand?! Why is it glowing?!”
Light, resembling sunlight, was seeping through Han-gyeol’s fingers.
What on earth was happening here…?
“Well, if I grabbed the sun, of course it’s going to glow.”
“No, no… I mean, how can a person even grab the sun?”
“Huh? Like this?”
“Wait, are you telling me the sun is actually in your hand right now?”
“Yeah, it is.”
I was dumbfounded.
I couldn’t believe it.
“Doesn’t it burn?”
“Not really. It’s not that hot.”
“But the surface temperature is supposed to be 6,000 degrees…”
It was still unbelievable.
But Han-gyeol smiled brightly as he spoke.
“If you don’t believe me, do you want to hold it too?”
“Is that… even possible?”
“Probably. Sit down; I’ll put it in your hands.”
Swallowing hard, I sat back down.
“Hold out your hands. Make sure you don’t let it slip away.”
“Okay, okay… I’m ready.”
I stretched out both hands and held them out to Han-gyeol.
Carefully, he opened his hand above mine, slowly revealing the sun.
When his hand was fully open, I stared at the small, round sun resting on my palms.
It was the size of a ping-pong ball, but it was unmistakably the sun.
Yet, it wasn’t hot at all.
Instead, it felt warm and calming, putting my mind at ease.
“This… this makes no sense!”
“Phew, good. It’s not leaving your hands either.”
“Would it leave someone else’s hands?”
“If the sun doesn’t like them, it’ll leave. Didn’t you know that?”
“Wouldn’t it be stranger if I did…?”
Even as I listened to Han-gyeol, my mind was spinning.
The sun on my hands rolled around playfully, as if it were trying to entertain me.
“I think it likes you. Look, it’s even showing off.”
“Ha… ha ha… I guess that’s nice…! Wait, what?”
As Han-gyeol and I stared at the sun, it began to emit a brighter light.
“Han-gyeol? Doesn’t it seem like the sun is getting brighter?! Is it going to explode?!”
“Huh? Why is it acting like this?”
The sun suddenly floated into the air and began to merge with me.
“Han-gyeol, what is this…?”
“They say it happens when it really likes someone. This is my first time seeing it too.”
“Wha-?! Am I going to burn to death?!”
“Don’t worry~ You won’t die.”
Han-gyeol laughed innocently.
Still… no matter how reassuring he sounded… this was—
“This doesn’t make any sense—!!!”
Finally, I screamed loudly and opened my eyes wide.
The scene in front of me had completely changed.
What? Where am I? The sun? Am I okay? Did I already burn up? Is this heaven?
“Eun-ha…? What’s wrong?”
“Han-gyeol?”
It was Han-gyeol, standing by the bed.
As soon as I saw him, I shouted.
“Han-gyeol, the sun! Where’s the sun?!”
“The sun? What sun?”
“You know—the one you grabbed in your hand! It was about the size of a ping-pong ball!”
“Are you talking about the sun…?”
“Yes, yes! The sun!”
“The sun is outside the window…? Also, how would someone grab the sun? Its surface temperature is 6,000 degrees. Did you have a dream?”
“A dream…?”
Could a dream feel this vivid?
Still dazed, I glanced out the window to see the sun floating normally above the sea.
“Haha… of course. That scared me.”
“What kind of dream did you have to be this startled?”
“I don’t know… it’s the first time I’ve had a dream like that… What kind of dream even was that?”
“You must be tired from sleeping in a different place. Come on, let’s get ready. We need to head out soon.”
“Oh, yeah. Right… I need to get a grip…!”
Shaking my head to clear my thoughts, I headed to the bathroom.
Even while washing my face, I couldn’t shake the memory of that dream.
When I came out of the bathroom, I hesitantly asked Han-gyeol, still unsure.
“Han-gyeol.”
“Yeah?”
“Can you check if my body feels hot?”
“Are you feverish? Let me check—!”
He reached to touch my forehead, but I quickly dodged.
“Careful—!”
“What?!”
“Um… I might be really hot.”
Han-gyeol looked at me with a deeply concerned expression.
“Are you seriously sick? How hot could you even be…?”
“Like… 6,000 degrees…?”
“What?”
“Uh, nothing?”
Despite my warning, Han-gyeol touched my forehead without hesitation.
Since he didn’t immediately pull his hand back, I figured I wasn’t 6,000 degrees after all.
“That’s weird… You don’t seem to have a fever.”
“Right?! Haha… hahaha…! I must’ve been out of my mind for a second.”
“Are you sure you’re okay? Should we stop by the hospital before leaving?”
“No, no, I’m fine now—! Phew… Thank goodness.”
“Are you really okay? Tell me honestly. We can delay the flight if we need to.”
Han-gyeol seemed really worried.
I mean, of course—after all the nonsensical things I’d been saying about holding the sun and being 6,000 degrees, who wouldn’t be concerned?
“I’m really fine—! I was just half-asleep.”
“You’re sure?”
“Yep! Sorry for worrying you.”
“Phew… You really scared me.”
“Hehe. Let’s get going! We have to hit that barbecue place you like one last time.”
“Yeah. Let’s pack up and head out.”
After reassuring him, we left our lodging.
As we drove out of the underground parking lot, the bright sunlight wrapped around us warmly.
For a moment, I panicked again, thinking I had stolen the sun.
“Today’s the sunniest day of the trip,” Han-gyeol said, glancing out the window.
“Really?”
“Yeah. It’s been great all along, but today feels extra sunny. Makes me want to stay one more day.”
“We can always come back~”
“That’s true.”
“Next time, should we bring our families?”
“That sounds good—! After Gangneung, let’s hit Jeju Island next.”
It must’ve been such an amazing trip that it inspired that strange dream.
Still, it was such a vivid dream that I doubt I’ll ever forget it.
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 157: Huh? (4)
chapters.content:
A month had passed since we returned from our trip to Jeju Island.
In the past month, I took the second part of the CPA exam.
There were quite a few questions that confused me, so it felt like hoping to pass was a stretch.
Meanwhile, Eun-ha spent her days working as usual, but recently, her health hadn’t been great.
“Eun-ha, is it the same today?”“Yeah… I still feel a bit sluggish and heavy.”
Eun-ha was leaning against the headboard, resting.
At first, I thought it was just a temporary slump, but it had been going on for days now.
“Should we skip visiting your parents today and go to the hospital instead?”
“Hmm… no, it’s not like I’m in serious pain. Let’s have lunch with my parents first, and then we can go to the hospital.”
We had planned to have lunch today with Eun-ha’s parents at a Korean restaurant.
It was one of the rare days her parents were free, and they had even invited me to join.
It wasn’t an invitation we could easily decline, but still…
“Don’t worry too much. I’m really okay! Other than feeling a bit off, I’m fine~”
“But didn’t you say you felt nauseous a few days ago? Is that better now?”
“Hmm… yeah, I think it’s okay. Let’s just have lunch with my parents first. We can go to the hospital afterward.”
“Alright, let’s do that.”
In the end, Eun-ha dragged her heavy body to the bathroom.
After washing up, she quickly changed and we headed to the restaurant.
While waiting on a bench outside the restaurant, I saw Eun-ha’s parents and her older brother, Eunwoo Hyung, approaching.
I quickly stood up and bowed to greet them.
“Hello.”
“You’re here early~? There’s still some time before our reservation.”
“I wanted to see Mom and Dad, so I came quickly~”
Eun-ha greeted her parents with an affectionate smile.
“Ah, I missed you too, my dear. How have you been, Han-gyeol?”
“I’ve been doing well. How about you both?”
“Oh, we’ve been great!”
Eun-ha’s mother replied with a bright smile.
Her father, standing beside her, also asked how I’d been doing.
“You two still look like you’re doing well. Everything good between you?”
“Yes, we’ve been well.”
“That’s good to hear.”
After exchanging greetings, Eunwoo Hyung gave me a warm welcome.
“Han-gyeol, how was your military service?”
“I completed it well. How about you, Hyung? All good?”
“Oh, me? I’m preparing for job applications now that I’ve graduated. Life’s manageable so far.”
“I wish you the best with that.”
It seemed like everyone was doing well.
“Alright, let’s head inside. This place serves good Korean food.”
“Sure, let’s go in.”
“Okay~”
Inside the reserved room, we ordered a simple course meal.
While waiting for the food to arrive, we shared stories.
“So, the new semester is starting soon, right? Han-gyeol, are you returning for your second semester as a freshman?”
“Yes, I’m planning to graduate as soon as possible and start working, especially since Eun-ha is graduating soon too.”
“Eun-ha said she only has one last semester left, right?”
“Yeah. I took a lot of summer and winter courses while Han-gyeol was in the military, so I can graduate early.”
“You kids seem so mature and capable. It’s really admirable.”
Eun-ha and I both felt a bit shy at her mother’s compliment.
“You two have been together since high school, so it’s been four years now?”
“Yes, that’s right.”
“It feels like just yesterday when I first saw you two together. Time flies~”
“Actually, if you think about it, I’m the reason these two got together,” Eunwoo Hyung chimed in.
Eun-ha and I tilted our heads in confusion.
“What do you mean, oppa? How did you bring us together?”
“If I hadn’t asked Han-gyeol to help me assemble my computer, would he have ever come to our house?”
“Oh, now that you mention it, that’s true. I’m always grateful for that.”
“See? Even Han-gyeol admits it.”
“Well, I think we would’ve ended up together no matter what. Right, Han-gyeol?”
Eun-ha looked up at me with a bright smile.
“Yeah, that’s true too.”
“See? Han-gyeol agrees with me!”
“Alright, you win this one, little sister.”
Eun-ha seemed especially cheerful, likely because it had been a while since she’d seen her family.
Soon, the server entered the room and placed abalone porridge in front of us as an appetizer.
As the lid was lifted, a savory aroma filled the room.
And at that moment—
“Ugh—!”
Eun-ha clapped her hand over her mouth and rushed out of the room.
Everyone in the room froze, staring after her in shock.
Then, all eyes turned to me, as if waiting for me to explain the mysterious situation.
Though I couldn’t say for sure, it felt like we were all thinking the same thing.
“Could it be… you two…?!”
“I’ll go check on her—!”
I quickly got up and followed Eun-ha out.
****
The Meal Was Postponed.
The lunch meeting was canceled, and we decided to visit the hospital with Eun-ha before contacting her parents later in the evening.
After a simple check-up, we entered the consultation room together, where the OB-GYN doctor calmly spoke.
“Congratulations. You’re pregnant. Five weeks along.”
I had a suspicion, but hearing it confirmed still felt surreal.
If I were to describe my feelings before hearing this news, I’d say I was honestly a bit scared.
I had just been discharged from the military, and I had less to my name now than before.
Graduating from college was still far off, and financial independence seemed out of reach for the moment.
I was overjoyed that Eun-ha and I were having a baby, but a part of me wondered if I could truly be a good husband and father.
Rather than pure happiness, my initial reaction to this sudden pregnancy was worry.
“Here is the ultrasound photo. At five weeks, you can’t hear the heartbeat yet, but that small round spot is the gestational sac.”
I carefully reached out for the ultrasound photo that the doctor handed over.
As I slowly lifted it to eye level, the image of our baby came into focus.
It was my first time seeing an ultrasound photo, and there it was—a tiny, round gestational sac nestled in Eun-ha’s womb.
It was so small yet so vivid.
This was our baby, mine and Eun-ha’s.
The moment I saw it, all the doubts I had vanished.
The worries that had weighed on me disappeared, replaced by an indescribable emotion.
My eyes welled up with tears as waves of emotion washed over me.
In my past, I had thought countless times about the meaning of life.
Was it simply accepting the life you were given and living it out?
Was it merely enduring repetitive days until they ended in monotony?
I had often wondered what I should pursue, what I should call happiness.
But here, in this moment, those thoughts never crossed my mind.
In this place, my daily life, my choices, and my actions all had meaning, culminating in this very moment.
“Eun-ha…”
I could hear the tremble in my voice.
Eun-ha looked at me, her eyes widening in surprise.
“Han-gyeol…? Why are you crying?!”
I wasn’t sure why I was crying.
I couldn’t even remember the last time I had cried, but now, tears wouldn’t stop flowing.
Eun-ha, half-smiling and half-confused, gently wiped my tears away.
What filled my heart was a mix of overwhelming happiness and a newfound sense of responsibility.
“I’ll… I’ll make sure you’re happy…”
I held Eun-ha’s hand tightly as she wiped my tears.
Though surprised at first, she quickly smiled her usual warm smile and nodded.
“Okay!”
As I locked eyes with Eun-ha, a discreet cough broke the moment.
“Ahem—!”
Startled, both Eun-ha and I turned to look at the doctor again.
The doctor proceeded to explain the precautions and next steps before we left the hospital.
Holding my hand tightly as we walked, Eun-ha looked up at me and spoke.
“Han-gyeol, I was a little scared at first.”
“Huh?”
“I mean, of course, I’m thrilled to be having a baby with you! But the thought of a child growing inside me… it made me nervous and worried. It was a little scary.”
Eun-ha continued, her voice soft.
“But the moment I saw you, I realized I didn’t need to worry. It’s my first time seeing you cry, you know.”
“Cough… Sorry. I wanted to be dependable, but I got overwhelmed…”
“No, no! That’s not what I meant.”
Eun-ha quickly shook her head.
Then, she gently placed her hand on my cheek.
“Han-gyeol, you’re such a strong person, but with me and now our baby, you’re so tender and vulnerable. It made me realize how mature and reliable you are. I’m truly happy to be having your baby. Thank you. Thank you for giving me such a wonderful blessing. I feel like meeting you was the best luck of my life. Han-gyeol, let’s have a group hug—just the three of us! Come here!”
Eun-ha confessed her love with a bright smile and opened her arms wide.
Seeing her beaming at me, I slowly stepped forward and embraced her tightly.
“Meeting you was the best luck of my life too, Eun-ha.”
“Hehe, this feels so nice.”
“Yeah, it really does.”
“Han-gyeol, thank you for coming into my life. I love you so much.”
“I love you too. Thank you for being with me.”
The meaning of my life is here, in this moment, with them.
“Eun-ha, I’ll make sure you’re always happy.”
“And I’ll make sure you’re happy too, Han-gyeol!”
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 158: Responsibility (1)
chapters.content:
I called both sets of parents to share the news of my pregnancy. Han-gyeol’s parents, who live in Busan, said they would come up immediately, and I held Han-gyeol’s hand as we headed home.
To be honest, I’m a little nervous.
I know I’m still young to have a child.
I was slightly anxious, fearing our parents might be furious.
Sensing my worried expression, Han-gyeol squeezed my hand tightly.“Eun-ha, don’t worry.”
“Huh?”
“It’s okay. I’ll explain everything.”
“No, Han-gyeol, this isn’t just your responsibility.”
“I know. Let’s go inside.”
“Okay.”
I unlocked the door and stepped into the house.
Even though we opened the door, no one greeted us warmly.
We carefully took off our shoes and entered, finding my parents sitting on the couch.
In the corner of the sofa, my brother was also seated.
“Sit down.”
“Yes.”
Han-gyeol and I cautiously sat on the floor.
My mother and brother stayed silent as my father began to speak.
“So, you’re saying there’s a baby?”
The cold tone in my father’s voice scared me a little.
I understood it was too much to expect a joyful reaction.
While I kept my mouth tightly shut, Han-gyeol, still holding my hand firmly, responded.
“Yes, it’s five weeks.”
“The reason we allowed you two to live together was because we trusted this wouldn’t happen. You’re aware of that, right?”
“Yes, we are. I’m deeply sorry for disappointing you.”
“Haa…”
My father let out a deep sigh.
“Well, what’s done is done. There’s no point in dwelling on it. What do you plan to do now?”
I didn’t know how to answer that.
But Han-gyeol replied in a serious tone.
“I will take responsibility.”
“And how exactly? You just finished your military service, and you still have three and a half years of university left. How will you take responsibility?” ṙἈΝΟꞖÈꞨ
My father shot back immediately, targeting Han-gyeol.
Feeling like Han-gyeol was being scolded too harshly, I spoke up as well.
“I-I only have one semester left, so I could take a leave of absence, have the baby, and then return—”
“And after you return? What then? Financial independence? Childcare? Do you think starting a family is that easy?”
My father cut me off sharply.
When I was at a loss for words, his gaze shifted back to Han-gyeol.
“Fine. It’s obvious Eun-ha should take a leave of absence. But what happens after that? You’re not planning to rely entirely on your parents for support, are you?”
My father’s harsh words made my mother interject gently.
“Dear, don’t be too hard on them… Try to be a bit calmer…”
“No, I need to hear it. Han-gyeol, tell me. What’s your plan moving forward?”
My father’s cold words seemed to pierce Han-gyeol.
I was worried he might feel hurt, but Han-gyeol spoke calmly.
“I plan to start working as soon as possible. However, I also know this is selfish and irresponsible to say, but I believe I must seek help from both families. As you said, I’m not in a position to take full responsibility right now.”
“As you admitted, that’s selfish and irresponsible. Are you just asking for help without a concrete plan?”
My father’s coldness continued.
Feeling like Han-gyeol was being scolded too harshly, I spoke up again.
“Dad…! We—”
“Stay out of this!”
In the end, my father raised his voice.
I thought he might show a little warmth, but even as my eyes welled up, he didn’t waver.
But then, still holding my hand, Han-gyeol spoke.
“I’m not asking for help without a plan.”
“Then tell me your plan.”
Han-gyeol continued speaking steadily.
“I’ve already passed the first part of the tax accountant exam. Although I took the second part this year, I believe it would be better to prepare for the second exam next year. So, I think it’s right for me to return to school while preparing for the exam. Of course, I also plan to work part-time.”
Han-gyeol spoke as if trying to persuade my father, but it still didn’t seem to satisfy him.
“There’s no guarantee you’ll pass the second exam next year. And balancing studies, work, and exam preparation isn’t going to be easy.”
Without a moment’s hesitation, Han-gyeol replied to my father’s doubts.
“I promise to keep my word. No matter what happens, I will take responsibility. Once I obtain the tax accountant license, I’ll immediately take a three-year leave to begin work. That way, financial independence will become feasible. Could you… could you help us for just two years?”
“You still don’t think this is irresponsible, do you?”
It felt like Dad kept putting Han-gyeol down.
Thinking the conversation wasn’t going anywhere, I was about to suggest leaving the house with Han-gyeol.
But then, he spoke up.
“I don’t think this is the time to cling to my pride… I know it’s shameful, selfish, and irresponsible to ask… but I believe this is the only way to ensure Eun-ha and our unborn child can be happy…”
Hearing Han-gyeol’s words, Dad’s stern gaze wavered.
“Please… help us.”
Slowly, Han-gyeol bowed his head to Dad.
Moved by his action, I too bowed my head, waiting anxiously for Dad’s response.
An unbearable silence stretched on until Dad let out a long sigh.
“Whew… Fine. I’ll help you. Now lift your heads.”
At his words, both of us slowly raised our heads.
“Mark my words. Building a family is never easy. There will be times when you’ll have to endure hardships for the sake of your family and moments when you’ll have to swallow your pride. But no matter what, you must persevere. You’re about to become a married couple and parents. Never take that responsibility lightly. Do you understand?”
I nodded vigorously, tears streaming down my face.
“Yes, I’ll keep that in mind.”
“If things had gone as planned, Eun-ha would have graduated next year, and even if you hadn’t had a child, as parents, we were prepared to support you both financially until you graduated. So, consider this the same support we would have provided. For additional expenses, cover them yourselves, but if you fall short, come to us. Do you understand?”
Dad had given us his blessing.
Mom turned her head slightly, wiping away tears.
“So, when are the in-laws arriving?”
“Ah—they said they’d come up right away.”
“They likely haven’t arranged accommodations yet. Tell them to stay here for now. We’ll discuss the plans more thoroughly when they arrive.”
“Yes…! Understood.”
For the first time, Han-gyeol seemed to relax, a hint of relief lighting up his face.
“From now on, call me Father-in-law.”
“Yes…! I will, Father-in-law.”
“Good.”
Just like that, Han-gyeol truly became part of our family.
The tense atmosphere gradually lifted, and the house returned to its usual warmth.
As the mood lightened, my brother asked about the baby.
“So? Do you have a picture of the baby?”
“It’s in my pocket. Want to see?”
“Yeah, I do. It’s my niece or nephew now, right? Mom, Dad, aren’t you curious too?”
“Yes, let’s see our grandchild.”
I pulled the ultrasound picture from my pocket, and everyone gathered around to take a look.
“Wow… it’s so tiny. This is my niece or nephew?”
“It’s only five weeks, so of course, it’s small. They’ll grow big and strong later.”
“Do you know if it’s a boy or a girl yet?”
“You can’t tell at five weeks~”
“So, have you thought of names for the baby?”
Han-gyeol confidently answered Mom’s question.
“If it’s a girl, we’re thinking of Eunbyul. If it’s a boy, Hanbyul.”
“Those are beautiful names. What about you? Do you prefer a granddaughter or a grandson?”
Mom nudged Dad playfully as she asked.
“Ahem… A grandchild is good enough for me.”
“Come on, answer properly.”
“A granddaughter.”
“You’ll be disappointed if it’s a grandson then~”
“No, as I said, I’d be happy either way.”
“People usually pick a nickname for the baby before it’s born. Did you come up with one?”
My brother asked about the baby’s nickname.
Come to think of it, we hadn’t decided on one yet.
“We haven’t picked one yet.”
“Really? Eun-ha, didn’t you mention having a strange dream before?”
At Han-gyeol’s question, I suddenly remembered a dream I had in Jeju.
“Oh! Now that you mention it, I dreamt of holding the sun in my hands, and it kind of… merged into me.”
“Oh my goodness. You dreamt of holding the sun? That means the baby is destined for greatness!”
Mom’s eyes widened as she reacted to my dream.
“Then let’s call the baby Haetnim*. What do you think, Han-gyeol? Do you like it?”
I looked at him, and he smiled his usual gentle smile as he replied.
“Yeah, I love it.”
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 159: Responsibility (2)
chapters.content:
Time flew by quickly, and it was already December, with the end of the university semester approaching.
It had been three months since Eun-ha and I became husband and wife legally.
Given our current situation, a wedding ceremony seemed impossible, so we settled for registering our marriage.
The image of Eun-ha’s joyful expression at the district office when we filed our marriage registration still lingered vividly in my mind.
She had smiled happily all day, her face glowing with joy, though I wasn’t sure what exactly made her so delighted.University studies, preparations for childbirth, work, and studying for the second stage of the tax accountant exam.
For the past three months, I had been juggling all of this without letting anything slip through the cracks.
Since I couldn’t afford to neglect any of it, I pushed myself relentlessly, as if carving away at my very bones.
From Monday to Friday, my mornings were filled with first-period classes.
In the afternoons, I worked at my mother-in-law’s company from 2:00 PM to 6:30 PM.
Initially, I considered tutoring or finding another job, but my mother-in-law offered me a convenient position and promised to compensate me generously.
It was probably because I was her son-in-law, which made me feel a little guilty, but this wasn’t the time to be picky.
Although I could rely on financial support from my parents for now, I knew that once the baby arrived, our expenses would undoubtedly increase significantly. ṟÁꞐ𝐨ʙÈș
I had no prior experience with parenting, even in my previous life.
Faced with such uncertainty, I needed to save as much as possible to reduce the unknowns.
Eun-ha also took on some simple video editing work while I was busy with my job.
I was strongly against it at first, but she assured me it was just a few hours a day to pass the time and told me not to worry.
After observing her for a few days, I saw that she only took on minor tasks, so I reluctantly agreed.
Still, I couldn’t help but feel uneasy, so I threw myself even harder into my studies and work.
“Phew… All done.”
After finishing my tasks, I quickly prepared to leave.
Since I usually left the office about 30 minutes after everyone else, I turned off the office lights and stepped out of the building.
Taking the subway straight home, I was greeted at the door by Eun-ha, standing with her arms wide open, waiting for me.
“Darling~ You’re back?”
“I’m home~”
Eun-ha smiled brightly and wrapped her arms around me.
This moment, coming home to her after a long day, was the happiest part of my day.
“How’s our little Haet doing~?”
“Hehe. The baby’s movements are much stronger now. She’s growing well.”
Legally, doctors couldn’t reveal the baby’s gender before 32 weeks, but from the ultrasound, we figured out it was a girl.
Thinking about a daughter who would take after Eun-ha filled me with an endless supply of energy.
“Eun-ha, shall we start making dinner now?”
Every evening, Eun-ha and I cooked dinner together.
Since we only got to spend time together during lunch breaks and after work, cooking dinner together was our way of catching up.
It was also a rare time for us to have deeper conversations.
“You’re calling me Eun-ha again~”
Eun-ha poked my cheek playfully.
Since our marriage, we’d decided to address each other as “darling” or “honey,” but I wasn’t used to it yet.
Honestly, calling her “honey” still felt a little embarrassing, so I rarely said it.
“D-Darling…! Shall we make dinner now?”
“Hehe. Honestly, I’m more comfortable with you calling me Eun-ha too. But now that we’re married, we should get used to it, right? Don’t you think, Haet’s daddy?”
“I’m trying! Are you hungry? Let’s hurry up and make dinner. Our Haet must be hungry too.”
“Yeah, let’s do it together.”
“Let me change out of these clothes first~”
“Okay, go ahead!”
When I came out of the room after changing, Eun-ha was standing there, smiling at me.
As I walked over, she quickly placed an apron around my neck and tied the strings.
“You seem really happy~”
“Hehe. It’s because I love you so much. Can I hug you one more time?”
“Come here~”
“Yes~”
As I spread my arms wide, Eun-ha snuggled into my embrace.
“Darling. Darling. Darling.”
“Yes, honey?”
“Oh? You’re calling me ‘honey’ now~?”
“I told you I’m trying!”
“Was today’s work tough?”
Without hesitation, I shook my head in response to Eun-ha’s question.
“Not at all.”
“But you’re studying and working at the same time, even on weekends. You told me not to overwork myself, but aren’t you the one pushing too hard?”
“Oh, come on~ I’m totally fine. I’m still full of energy!”
“Still~ I wish you could take at least one weekday off to rest properly. Can I make dinner alone tomorrow?”
“Nope, not a chance.”
“Why not~”
When I refused without hesitation, Eun-ha nuzzled her face into my chest.
“Because I want to spend time with you~ Is that so bad?”
“No, I’m happy too, but I’m worried you’re overworking yourself.”
“I’m really not tired~ Besides, you always make lunch by yourself, don’t you?”
“That’s just heating up leftovers from the fridge!”
Seeing that she wasn’t going to back down, I gently stroked her head and asked:
“Do I look worn out these days?”
“A little? That’s why I want to help you more.”
“Really, I’m fine~ Thinking about you and our daughter gives me strength I didn’t know I had. So don’t worry too much. But you’re not overdoing it, right?”
At my question, Eun-ha immediately lifted her head and responded:
“Of course not! Thinking about you also gives me so much energy!”
“Okay, then. Let’s make dinner now. I’m starving~”
“Alright. But remember, if you ever feel tired, you can lean on me. We’re family.”
“Got it. You’re the best support I could ask for.”
Eun-ha and I always remained humble about our own efforts while respecting and appreciating each other’s.
Perhaps that’s the secret to why we haven’t had a single argument as a couple yet.
****
The Next Day:
As usual, I had lunch with Eun-ha before heading to work.
Since I needed to study for the tax accountant exam over the weekend, I planned to finish all my tasks perfectly by the end of the day.
I’d never made a mistake before, but I wasn’t about to take my work lightly just because I was the son-in-law.
“Hello, I’m here for work.”
“Oh, Han-gyeol, you’re here. I reviewed the report you submitted yesterday and sent it out this morning.”
Huh? Then… does that mean I have nothing to do today?
“Thank you. Were there any issues with it?”
“None at all~ There’s no urgent work today, so take it easy.”
“Can I do that? Everyone else is working hard, so I should too.”
Hearing my reply, my team leader smiled warmly.
I sat down at my desk, turned on my computer, and began my daily tasks.
I reviewed the schedule, recorded updates, and made notes on anything unusual.
“Huh.”
That’s when I realized—it had been two weeks since the tax accountant second exam results were released.
I’d been so busy that I hadn’t even thought to check.
Well, I was sure I didn’t pass, but I might as well look up my candidate number.
I logged into the results page and pulled up the list of successful candidates’ numbers.
Pressing Ctrl+F, I typed in my candidate number.
Click-click-
My number appeared with “1/1” in the search bar.
“Huh?”
I rubbed my eyes and checked my number again.
Then I erased the digits in the search bar and re-entered them, meticulously double-checking every digit as I typed.
Even after that, my number still showed up among the successful candidates.
“Huh…? W-Why is this…?”
I pinched my cheek and rubbed my eyes, but the number didn’t change—it was undeniably mine.
As the shock of reality sank in, my pupils widened.
Forgetting I was in the office, I suddenly leaped up and shouted.
“Ahhhhhhhhhh!!”
“What’s going on? Did something happen?! Which client?!”
My team leader stood up, startled.
I needed to explain the situation, but words wouldn’t come out right.
“I-I passed!”
“Passed? Passed what?”
“The tax accountant exam!”
When I whispered my response, my team members were all taken aback.
A brief silence hung in the air before everyone started congratulating me.
“Wow! Really? Didn’t you say you were preparing for next year’s exam?”
“I didn’t think I’d pass either… I still can’t believe it. Why did I pass?”
“Still, congratulations!”
“Han-gyeol, congrats! Eun-ha and the CEO will be thrilled!”
“Too bad the CEO’s at a meeting—oh, wait! She’s back! CEO!”
Right at that moment, my mother-in-law walked into the office.
“What’s all the commotion? What happened?”
“Mother-in-law!”
As soon as I saw her, I greeted her with a bright smile.
“This is the office, so shouldn’t you be using a different title?”
“Oh—! I’m sorry. I got too excited.”
“No matter how good the news, it’s ‘CEO’ in the office, understand?”
“Yes, understood.”
“So, what’s the news?”
“I passed the tax accountant exam!”
When I said it confidently, my mother-in-law—no, the CEO—looked at me with wide eyes.
“You passed the second exam too?!”
“Yes! I’ve checked multiple times, and it’s confirmed!”
Her jaw dropped, but she quickly broke into a beaming smile.
“Really?! Oh, our son-in-law is amazing!”
“Thank you! I just found out myself!”
“We can’t waste time. Han-gyeol, go home immediately. You need to share the news with Eun-ha too.”
“Yes! I’ll do that! Thank you all for the congratulations—see you tomorrow!”
“Hurry! Take a taxi and be careful on the road!”
“Yes—thank you!”
I couldn’t wait a second longer to share the news with Eun-ha.
As soon as I left the office, I hailed a taxi and headed straight home.
Sitting in the backseat, I tapped my feet anxiously until we arrived.
I quickly paid the fare, dashed up the stairs, and stood in front of our door.
Ding-dong!
Taking a deep breath to calm myself, I rang the doorbell carefully, not wanting to startle Eun-ha or our little Haet.
-Who is it?
“It’s me, Eun-ha.”
-Oh, honey?!
Her voice grew louder as she neared the door, and soon it swung open.
“Honey?! What are you doing home so early?!”
“Darling, I passed the tax accountant exam! I passed the second exam this year!”
“What—?! Seriously?! But you said you were sure you failed!”
“But I passed! I came running to tell you right away.”
“That’s amazing! You worked so hard for this—it’s really well-deserved!”
Eun-ha beamed with genuine pride, her eyes welling up as she looked at me.
“Eun-ha.”
“Yes…?”
“I’m home, so you need to hug me now. Come on—hurry, with Haet too.”
I opened my arms wide, and Eun-ha jumped right into them.
“Honey, you’ve worked so hard…! I felt so bad seeing you push yourself so much…”
“Oh, come on—what’s there to feel bad about? I promised to make you happy, didn’t I? I’m so happy right now! I love you, Eun-ha, and I love Haet so much!”
“Me too! I love you so much! Seeing you happy makes me happy too!”
“Let’s have a special dinner tonight!”
“Okay! I’ll cook something amazing for you! What do you want?”
I smiled brightly and replied,
“Pork bulgogi!”
--- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 160: Responsibility (3)
chapters.content:
The new year had come, and the due date for delivery was approaching quickly.
Since the 30th week of pregnancy, we had moved out of the house near the university and were staying at Eun-ha’s family home.
With Eunwoo Hyung and Hyun-joo Noona frequently visiting, Eun-ha was never left alone.
Thanks to the help of her family, the preparations for childbirth were proceeding smoothly.
With the delivery due next week, we planned to be admitted to the hospital as soon as the time came.
The doctor advised that, for a first-time birth, it would be better for the husband to stay close by to ease the mother’s anxiety.
Although I was currently in the middle of my tax accountant internship, I was fortunate to be training at a tax firm run by a family acquaintance, who kindly accommodated my situation.
At first, I was treated a bit like a parachute hire... but well, that’s in the past now.
These days, they’ve been saying I should definitely join the firm after my internship ends.
While nothing is confirmed yet, the suggested salary they casually mentioned was enticing enough that I might just continue working there.As the due date drew near, Eun-ha became even more mindful of her health.
She carefully chose easily digestible meals and took light walks around the house.
It seemed like her way of calming her fears about childbirth.
Because of this, I hardly left her side, helping her more than usual.
“Sweetheart, ah~.”
“Ah~.”
Feeding her meat with vegetables, Eun-ha smiled happily as she ate.
Watching her chew thoroughly and swallow made her look incredibly lovely.
“When you feed me, it tastes even better.”
“That’s a relief! Want some more?”
“Mm-hmm, just one more bite.”
To avoid putting too much strain on her stomach, we split her meals into smaller portions.
“Got it. Here, ah~.”
“Thanks, I’ll enjoy this~.”
After her small meal, Eun-ha and I sat together on the couch, chatting away.
Though I was trying to ease her worries, I wasn’t sure if my efforts were entirely getting through.
Still, I resolved to do my best for her.
“Honey.”
“Yes, sweetheart?”
“Hehe, I love it when you call me sweetheart.”
“Sweetheart, sweetheart, sweetheart.”
“Yes! Honey!”
Eun-ha answered with a bright smile.
“Do you prefer when I call you by your name or ‘sweetheart’?”
“That’s a tough question. I like both, but if I had to choose…”
“Mm-hmm, if you had to?”
“I like it when you call me sweetheart.”
“Why’s that?”
“Well, anyone can call me by my name, but only you call me sweetheart.”
“Got it. I’ll call you sweetheart more often.”
“Thanks~ But honey…”
“Yes?”
“Suddenly, I feel like eating pineapple.”
“I’ll get it for you~.”
Since Eun-ha got pregnant, she had been craving fruit often.
Sometimes, even in the middle of the night, she’d ask for fruit, so I made sure to stock the fridge with a variety: apples, strawberries, peaches, Shine Muscat grapes, watermelon, pineapple—you name it. ℞ἈƝỔＢЁS
Thanks to online delivery, everything arrived within half a day.
“Keeping the fridge stocked with fruit is so convenient and efficient!”
“Anything else you feel like eating?”
“Nope, just a little pineapple will do.”
Heading to the kitchen, I grabbed a pineapple, cut it into bite-sized pieces, and brought it back to her.
Eun-ha took a bite and smiled blissfully.
“Is it good?”
“Mm-hmm. It tastes even better because you prepared it.”
“There’s plenty, so let me know if you want more.”
“This is enough~.”
After finishing the pineapple, Eun-ha leaned back against the couch.
“I’ll massage your legs and feet. Stretch them out.”
As she was in the final month of pregnancy, Eun-ha’s feet and legs had become slightly swollen.
Since massages were said to help, I did it for her whenever I had the chance.
“They’re okay for now~.”
“I just want to do it~.”
“Hehe, then I won’t refuse~.”
As I massaged her legs and feet, Eun-ha happily called my name.
“Han-gyeol.”
“Yes?”
“Nothing, I just wanted to call your name. It’s been a while.”
“Really?”
“Yeah. It’s kind of amazing. At first, it was Han-gyeol, then Gyeol, and now even Honey. It makes me so happy.”
“I’ll make you even happier.”
“I don’t know if it’s possible to be happier than this. I’m so happy it feels unreal.”
“That’s high praise~.”
“I love you.”
“I love you, too~.”
We gazed at each other lovingly, locking eyes.
“We should do the same for Haet.”
“Of course~.”
Gently, I patted Eun-ha’s belly and spoke.
“Haet, Daddy loves you~.”
“Mommy loves you too, Haet~.”
****
On the third day of Eun-ha’s hospital stay, her labor pains began in the early morning hours, and she was promptly taken to the delivery room.
I waited anxiously outside the delivery room with my father-in-law, mother-in-law, and Eunwoo Hyung, praying for the safe delivery to conclude.
Although I had been told that labor for a first child could take longer than expected, my anxiety grew with each passing moment.
Unable to do anything but wait silently, I couldn’t shake the feeling of guilt.
The thought of Eun-ha enduring unimaginable pain broke my heart.
Hours passed as I paced in front of the delivery room until finally, the door opened, and a nurse stepped out.
“Your baby will be born soon. Could the husband come in now?”
“Yes…! Of course!”
I hurried into the delivery room. Following the nurse’s instructions, I washed my hands and donned a blue sterile gown.
Once I had put on the sterilized gloves, I entered the delivery room with my heart pounding.
The moment I stepped inside, the room was filled with the sound of a baby’s cry.
“-Waaah! Waaah!-”
The robust cries of our baby rang out, and tears instantly welled up in my eyes.
Through my blurred vision, I saw my wife, exhausted but smiling as she locked eyes with me.
“Sweetheart…! Haet is here…!”
“Yes…! You’ve worked so hard… You’ve done so, so well…!”
Eun-ha and I let our tears flow freely, engraving this moment in our hearts forever.
With the help of the nurse, I cut the umbilical cord. After a quick check-up and cleaning, our baby, Haet, was gently placed in Eun-ha’s arms.
Holding our precious, healthy, and beautiful baby, Eun-ha smiled with pure joy.
“Hello, Haet… Say hi to Daddy too, okay?”
“Hi, Haet. I’m Daddy… I’m… your Daddy…!”
Our tiny, beautiful, and precious daughter.
The living, breathing result of our love, she was everything we had dreamed of and more.
After Haet was taken to the nursery and Eun-ha completed a brief examination, she was moved to her hospital room.
I quickly stepped out of the delivery room to inform the waiting family.
By then, my parents had also arrived, and everyone stood up abruptly as I appeared.
“She’s healthy… She’s here…! And Eun-ha is healthy too…!”
At my words, the adults let out a collective sigh of relief.
My mother-in-law, her legs giving out from the tension, collapsed onto a chair.
“Thank goodness…!”
“You both worked so hard…!”
“Yes… Thank you all…! Truly, thank you…!”
The journey to bring our baby into the world had been a long one.
It was only thanks to the help and support of so many that we had made it this far.
I felt nothing but overwhelming gratitude and joy.
****
The first day after the delivery passed by in such a blur that I could hardly remember anything.
I massaged Eun-ha’s abdomen in the hospital room and helped her regain her strength.
I only remembered holding her hand tightly as she finally fell asleep after receiving iron supplements and fluids in the early morning hours.
The next morning, during visiting hours, the whole family gathered and headed to the nursery to see Haet.
“There’s Haet…!”
The nurse in the nursery brought Haet close to the glass window for us to see.
Eun-ha and the family all lit up with radiant smiles as they looked at her.
“Honey, Haet’s nose looks just like yours!”
“Oh my, you’re right. And doesn’t her mouth resemble Eun-ha’s?”
“Wow…! This is my niece?!”
“Shh…! She’s sleeping, so speak softly!”
Seeing Haet sleeping peacefully made my eyes well up with tears again.
My heart swelled with pride and gratitude as I saw how healthy she was.
“Oh dear, the baby’s daddy is crying again~.”
“I’m sorry… She’s just so beautiful. Our Haet… She’s so beautiful.”
“Oh, stop crying already~.”
“Right, honey~ We should only show Haet our smiles.”
After the brief visiting time ended, the family returned home.
Eun-ha planned to enter a postpartum care center in a few days, and I informed my workplace that our baby had been born healthy and well.
My colleagues sent congratulatory messages, celebrating with us.
“Honey…!”
“Yes, sweetheart. Do you need anything?”
“Hehe, I just called for you. At first, I was a bit scared of giving birth, but now that Haet is here, I’m so happy.”
“Yes, you’ve been through so much. It must’ve been so hard for you.”
At my words, Eun-ha placed her hand on my cheek and spoke.
“Thinking about you helped me endure it.”
“Thank you…! For saying that.”
I clasped her hand in mine, holding it gently yet firmly.
“Honey.”
“Yes?”
“I love you.”
“I love you too. More than anything in the world. I love you as much as I love Eun-ha.”
“Let’s live happily together, the three of us, from now on.”
In response to Eun-ha’s words, I answered with conviction.
“Yes! I’ll make us happy! You and Haet! Because now, I’m a dad!”
-- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 161: Parenting (1)
chapters.content:
Three months have passed since Eunbyul was born.
Now, she can hold her head up and even sucks on her fingers occasionally.
Watching her do these little things, I couldn’t help but find her utterly adorable.
But… parenting was far from easy.
“Waaahhhhh-!! Waaaahhhhh-!”
Hearing Eunbyul’s powerful cries, my husband and I rushed straight to her.
“Our little princess, what’s bothering you to bring out those tears?”
“We just changed her diaper a little while ago, and she’s been properly fed…”
Both Han-gyeol and I were first-time parents, so we were clumsy in more ways than one.
There were countless things we had to learn:How to change diapers, how to breastfeed properly—
From A to Z, we studied everything without missing a beat.
“Maybe she just wants to be held! Oh, come here, Eunbyul. Daddy’s got you~”
The moment my husband held Eunbyul in his arms, her cries began to subside.
It seems like she takes after me because she absolutely adores her dad.
Even when she cries loudly, she stops as soon as she’s in his arms.
Honestly, when she grows up and people ask her, ‘Do you like Mom or Dad better?’ she’s going to answer ‘Dad’ without a second of hesitation.
“Our Eunbyul really loves her daddy~”
“Looks like it. Must’ve taken after you. Wow, she’s gotten a bit heavier.”
“She’s three months old now. They say babies double in size compared to when they’re born.”
“Watching her grow so quickly makes me so happy~ I wonder when our Eunbyul will call me ‘Dad’ for the first time.”
Since it was the weekend, even though my husband must’ve wanted to relax, he enthusiastically helped take care of Eunbyul with me.
“It’s too soon for that~ Here, give Eunbyul to me. You should get some rest since it’s the weekend.”
“No, no, you take a break. I’ll calm her down and put her to sleep.”
“Oh, come on~ I can’t let you do all the work by yourself.”
“It’s fine… let’s switch later. We’ll do shifts. You should conserve your energy.”
Looking at my husband’s haggard face, I felt sorry for him, but I wasn’t exactly in great shape either.
Getting up multiple times throughout the night had left me utterly exhausted.
Maybe taking turns to care for Eunbyul in shifts would be more efficient…?
“Should we do that?”
“Yeah, I think that’s the best way.”
“Alright then, I’ll rest for just a little bit!”
“Okay, go ahead and rest.”
“Hold Eunbyul on the bed with you. I want to sleep next to you too.”
“Sure~”
We lay down on the bed, with my husband holding Eunbyul in his arms.
Leaning against the headboard, he looked so happy as he rested.
Our beautiful daughter, nestled against her dad, gazed intently at me.
“Our little girl~”
When I spoke lovingly to her, Eunbyul giggled and smiled brightly.
She’s so beautiful and precious.
When I gently offered her one of my fingers, her tiny hand wrapped around it.
So small yet warm, our little Eunbyul was growing up strong and healthy.
“Honey.”
“Yeah?”
“Our Eunbyul is just so lovable.”
“Of course~ She’s our daughter, after all.”
My husband said that as he gently brushed my hair back with one hand.
Feeling his warm touch, I smiled and looked up at him.
“Are you pampering me too?”
“Of course. Both Eunbyul and you are so precious to me.”
“I love it when you do that.”
“It’s been a while, hasn’t it? Did you miss it?”
At his question, I shook my head with a smile.
“Not at all. I can always feel your love for me.”
“I’m glad to hear that. Our little princess should feel that love too~”
“Waaah-!”
As if understanding our conversation, Eunbyul let out a happy squeal and smiled.
“Aww~ Do you understand what Mom and Dad are saying, Eunbyul~?”
“Ah-goo~!”
Hearing Eunbyul’s laughter, my husband smiled like he was the happiest man in the world.
“Honey, do you think our Eunbyul might be a genius?”
“Maybe~ What do you think she’ll grab at her first birthday? What do you want her to pick?”
“Anything is fine as long as she grows up healthy. That’s all I could ever ask for.”
“What if she brings home a boyfriend?”
At my playful question, my husband’s face stiffened slightly as he pulled Eunbyul closer to him.
“I hope that tragic day never comes…”
“Really? But look at us, happily married.”
“Still no. Eunbyul, promise me we’ll live together forever, okay?”
At his question, our precious daughter suddenly turned her head and looked at me instead.
“Hey, hey?! Look at Dad! Sweetie? This isn’t the time to look at Mom~”
“Seems like she doesn’t agree to living with you forever~”
“Oh no… That’s troubling! Sweetie? Look at Dad. Daddy’s here.”
My husband’s flustered expression was so endearing.
I have no idea how he’ll handle things when Eunbyul grows up and brings home a boyfriend.
“Looks like our little daddy’s girl is going to be tough to handle~”
“I already feel heartbroken…!”
And so, the three of us spent our days filled with happiness.
Of course… parenting was still incredibly challenging.
****
I didn’t even realize when I fell asleep.
It was as if someone had cut the film of my consciousness, and I was out.
It had been such a long time since I woke up on my own, not to Eunbyul’s cries.
I sat up, my hair still disheveled, and next to me lay my husband, who had also passed out like me.
I got up and went to Eunbyul’s crib. She was sound asleep, her tiny breaths steady and peaceful.
There was now another person in my life whose very presence brought an uncontainable smile to my face.
Our precious and beautiful daughter.
My parents say Eunbyul’s eyes and mouth resemble mine, while her nose takes after my husband.
But if you ask me, she’s the spitting image of her dad. Or maybe that’s just my imagination.
“Huh?”
Perhaps sensing my gaze, Eunbyul’s eyes slowly fluttered open.
I instinctively checked her diaper, wondering if she was uncomfortable, but the moment our eyes met, she smiled brightly.
Her giggles and radiant smile filled me with happiness.
“Eunbyul~ Come to Mommy~”
I lifted her gently and held her close.
Rocking her softly in my arms, she gave me the most innocent, joyful smile.
“Eunbyul~ Should we go see Daddy?”
“Ahhh-!”
“Alright, let’s go see Daddy~”
I sat on the bed, placing Eunbyul on my lap. Together, we looked at my husband, who was still sleeping.
Eunbyul seemed to enjoy watching her dad sleep, smiling brightly at the sight.
Without crying or fussing, she simply watched him for a good ten minutes.
Finally, feeling the gaze of his daughter and wife, my husband’s eyes slowly opened.
His sleepy eyes scanned us before a soft smile spread across his face.
“Is this heaven…?”
“What are you talking about, waking up like that? Did you have a dream?”
At my question, he replied cheerfully.
“When I woke up, I saw not one but two angels in front of me. I must’ve been mistaken.”
At his compliment, both Eunbyul and I smiled brightly at him.
Seeing us, my husband’s eyes widened slightly, and he added,
“Wow, you two smile exactly the same.”
“Really? But she looks more like you~”
“No way. That smile just now—the angle and the way the corners of your mouths lifted—it’s exactly like yours. Right, Eunbyul?”
“Whhh-!”
“See? Even Eunbyul agrees with me! How is our little one already so smart? Say, ‘Daddy.’ Come on, say ‘Daddy.’”
“Whhhh-!”
Eunbyul let out a spirited sound, but at just three months old, it was still a bit early for actual words.
“She’ll need at least nine months for that~”
“That’s way too long! I can’t wait to hear her call me ‘Daddy.’ I’ll be so happy, don’t you think?”
“Definitely. If she calls me ‘Mommy,’ I might just float away from happiness.”
“Trying to become an actual angel? No way. You’re staying by my side forever.”
My husband’s sweet words always made my heart flutter, no matter how many times I heard them.
“Of course~ Once the kids are grown, let’s spend our golden years just the two of us.”
“Isn’t that thinking way too far ahead? Eunbyul is only three months old~”
“Raising kids will fly by before you know it!”
“Will it? Alright, once the kids are grown, we’ll enjoy our time together again.”
“Absolutely! Let’s make that happen!”
As I answered confidently, Eunbyul chimed in with her own sound.
“Ahhh-!”
“Oh dear, is our little one upset about us talking about being alone together?”
“Aww~ Were you feeling left out, princess? Then will you live with Daddy forever~?”
This time, I thought she might respond, but Eunbyul simply turned her head slightly away.
“Our little one… You’re quite decisive, aren’t you?”
“Must’ve taken after you~ She’s going to grow up to be bold and independent.”
“Honestly, I’d prefer if she takes after you. It’d be better, don’t you think?”
“What’s wrong with you? You’re responsible and amazing. Lately, you’ve been even more impressive.”
Hearing my praise, my husband broke into a wide smile.
He’s surprisingly weak to compliments, isn’t he?
“Really? Hearing that from you gives me so much energy.”
“Are you hungry? Should we eat soon?”
“Let’s order in today since we’re so tired. What do you feel like eating?”
Grateful for his consideration, I replied confidently.
“Pork bulgogi”
“No, tell me what you want, not what I’d like~”
“No, really! I’m craving pork bulgogi!”
“Alright, then pork bulgogi it is.”
“Whhhh-!”
Before I could finish, Eunbyul chimed in, stealing the spotlight.
“Our little one doesn’t have teeth yet, so no pork bulgogi for you~”
-- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 162: Parenting (2)
chapters.content:
It’s been nine months since Eunbyul was born.
Both my wife and I were gradually getting used to parenting, and now we were much quicker at handling things.
Nowadays, when I return home, Eunbyul often crawls quickly toward the front door.
Just seeing the picture of Eunbyul on one side of my work desk fills me with energy, even when I feel drained.
“Han-gyeol, aren’t you leaving yet?”
“Oh, yes. I’ll leave as soon as I finish this up.”
“It’s not a busy season, so take it easy~ I’m heading out first.”
“Alright. See you tomorrow. Have a safe trip home.”
“Okay~”
I hurriedly wrapped up my work and left the office.The subway ride home was as suffocating as ever.
During rush hour, people crammed into every station, making it hard to stand properly in this “hell train.”
As always, I thought to myself, Should I just buy a car? Yeah, maybe it’s finally time—
Ding-dong!
- The doors are opening.
“Ah! Excuse me, I need to get off! Sorry, I’m getting off now!”
Right when I resolved to buy a car, my stop arrived.
Dragging my tired body out of the subway station, I walked the familiar path home.
On the way, I stopped by a fruit store I frequent and picked up a bag of seasonal fruits before heading home.
“I’m home! Honey, I’m back!”
As soon as I opened the door, Eunbyul crawled quickly from the living room to greet me.
The sight of my daughter welcoming me with a bright smile instantly washed away the fatigue of the day.
“Ah-ba! Ah-ba!”
The moment I saw Eunbyul’s joyful smile, I dropped my bag and lifted her up.
“Aww, my sweet girl~ Were you a good girl while Appa* was away?”
“Ah-buuu!”
“Really? Such a good girl~ Why is my baby so perfect~?”
Eunbyul burst into giggles, delighted at the sudden change in perspective as I held her up.
As I embraced her, my wife came running from the kitchen.
“Honey~ Welcome home!”
With a smile as radiant as Eunbyul’s, my wife looked at me warmly.
She wrapped her arms around me, joining the hug, while I held our daughter.
Happiness overflowed in an instant, and I pulled my wife into the embrace with my free hand.
“Yeah, I’m back~ Was it tough taking care of Eunbyul?”
“No, not at all~ You wouldn’t believe how well she’s been sleeping these days. I actually got some work done this afternoon.”
“That’s a relief. The food smells amazing. What’s for dinner?”
“I made your favorite—spicy pork stir-fry! And there’s doenjang-jjigae too.”
“Wow, I can’t wait to eat. Let me just change clothes real quick. Can you hold Eunbyul for a moment?”
“Sure, go ahead. Eunbyul, come to amma~ Appa needs to change his clothes.”
My wife reached out to take Eunbyul, but she clung tightly to my shirt.
“Here we go again~ She just won’t let go of you once she’s in your arms.”
“Eunbyul, Appa just needs to change clothes. Can you let go for a bit?”
“Ah-buuu!”
Her stubbornness reminded me of my wife’s personality.
“She really is my daughter, huh? Loves Appa so much. Fine, I guess I won’t let go either~”
Even though I needed to change, my wife couldn’t resist hugging me again.
“Honey, hugging you is so comforting.”
“I feel the same, holding my lovely wife and daughter. I’m so happy.”
“Let’s stay like this for a little longer. Oh? What’s in your hand?”
“I bought a bag of fruit on the way home.”
“You must’ve been tired; you didn’t have to stop. Hehe, but thank you. You’re the best. I love you~”
My wife kissed my cheek with a soft mwah.
“I love you too, more than anything. Now, let me really change this time.”
“Eunbyul, come to amma now~ Appa needs to rest.”
“Ah-buuu!”
Eunbyul clung tightly to my shirt again, refusing to let go.
Eventually, I carefully pried her little fingers off one by one and handed her to my wife before she could burst into tears. I quickly changed and came back out. ℝåＮỔ𝐁ÈŚ
“Eunbyul~”
“Ah-buuuu!”
She immediately wriggled out of her mom’s arms and toddled over to cling to my leg.
Now I understand why people become doting parents—she’s just too adorable and lovable.
“Honey, can you watch Eunbyul for a bit? I’ll set the table.”
“Sure thing~ Eunbyul, let’s play with Appa! Want to fly like an airplane?”
“Ah-buuu!”
Lying on the sofa, I lifted Eunbyul into the air, moving her around like a flying jet.
Her laughter echoed through the room, filling my heart with joy.
After a while, my wife called from the kitchen.
“Honey, come eat!”
“Alright~ Eunbyul, let’s go eat! Vroooom~”
I stood up, carrying Eunbyul like a fighter jet, and placed her in her high chair at the dining table.
After securing her bib and handing her a small spoon, I sat down.
Eunbyul had started eating baby food on her own since she turned eight months old.
At first, she couldn’t even get the spoon to her mouth properly, but now she’s gotten the hang of it. Still, food often ended up on her bib or around her mouth.
“Look at you, Eunbyul. You’re eating so well now!”
“Yeah, she’s definitely learning faster than other kids her age. And she eats so well too.”
“She’s so adorable.”
When I patted Eunbyul’s head, she smiled just like her mom.
“Honey, how’s work these days?”
“It’s not too busy right now, but it’ll pick up in March and May. I’ll probably have to work overtime then. How about you?”
“Being a freelancer means I can control my workload, but my rates have gone up, so I’m happy. Maybe we should open another savings account? We’ve been saving more than we spend, and this month’s living expenses were even under budget.”
Both my wife and I are frugal.
Her income wasn’t small, and combined with mine, we were steadily building our savings.
As we’d promised my father, we were now close to achieving financial independence.
“Hmm, should we? Why don’t you start your own business? You’re talented enough. What do you think?”
“Well, I enjoy what I’m doing now, but I’m not confident yet. For now, I want to focus on the steady work I have.”
“Alright, but don’t overdo it, okay? Remember how you stayed up all night that one time?”
“Oh, that? The client offered double pay if I finished by the next day, so I couldn’t resist.”
“Even so, health comes first. You know that, right?”
“Of course. You too, right?”
“Absolutely.”
“Ah-buuu!”
Eunbyul, who seemed upset that only Amma* and Appa were talking, joined in with her own babble.
“Yes, Eunbyul, you need to stay healthy too. Let’s wipe your mouth~ amma will do it for you.”
My wife gently wiped Eunbyul’s mouth with a tissue as she continued to babble,
“Amm—mmma—”
“What’s that, Eunbyul? What are you trying to say?”
“Amm—amma!”
When Eunbyul suddenly blurted out her first word, both my wife and I froze in place.
Our eyes widened as we looked at each other in disbelief, then immediately turned our attention to Eunbyul.
“Eunbyul, what did you just say? amma? Say it again—amma!”
“Amma!”
“Honey! Eunbyul just said ‘amma’!”
“Yes! I heard it clearly too!”
My wife and I jumped up from our chairs, gazing at Eunbyul with love and astonishment.
“That’s right. Amma, it’s Amma. Want to say it one more time?”
“Amma!”
Tears welled up in my wife’s eyes as she heard herself called “amma” for the first time.
“Oh, my sweet girl! You did so well. Yes, it’s amma.”
As my wife beamed with joy, Eunbyul giggled, still clutching her little spoon.
“Eunbyul, what about Appa? Can you say Appa? Appa!”
“Aa!”
“That’s right, that’s right! Let’s try again—Appa! Appa!”
“A~”
My heart started pounding.
I don’t think I’ve ever felt this excited in my life.
With my eyes filled with anticipation, I locked gazes with my daughter.
“A~ppa!”
The moment she said “Appa,” a wave of overwhelming emotion washed over me.
It was a feeling too deep and profound to put into words, filling every corner of my heart.
“Yes, that’s right! I’m Appa! Appa!”
“Appa! Amma!”
My wife and I burst into laughter, soaking in the joy as we celebrated in the living room.
We were practically glowing with happiness, forgetting all about dinner for the moment.
“Honey! Eunbyul called me ‘amma’!”
“Yes! And I heard her call me ‘Appa’ too!”
“Is our Eunbyul a genius?! Could she really be?!”
“I think so, maybe?!”
While we marveled at her brilliance, Eunbyul continued eating her meal unfazed.
“Alright, let’s finish eating first!”
“Yes, let’s do that!”
After a meal full of laughter and smiles, we cleaned up quickly and took turns holding Eunbyul.
I gently patted her back until she let out a small burp, then sat her down on the sofa, looking at her lovingly.
Eunbyul, seemingly puzzled by why her parents were staring at her so intently, tilted her head and looked back and forth between us.
“Should we try one more time with her?”
“Yes! Let’s ask her again. Eunbyul, who are we?”
“Appa! Amma!”
Hearing it again made my heart swell with emotion.
My wife and I hugged each other tightly and rolled on the living room floor in sheer delight.
“Ah~ I’m so happy today.”
“Me too! I’m so happy!”
It was a day filled with endless laughter.
We’re Amma and Appa to the most precious daughter in the world.
Life couldn’t be any better.
-- The End OF The Chapter --
[TL: Amma & Appa are Korean words for mom and dad.
