chapters.title: Chapter 163: Parenting (3)
chapters.content:
Eunbyul has grown so quickly and is already 21 months old.
Every morning, around seven o’clock, she wakes up on her own and comes to find us in our room.
Today, she woke up a bit earlier than usual and climbed onto our bed before the alarm clock went off.
“Amma, Appa~”
Pressing firmly on our arms to wake us, the first thing she said was—
“I’m hungry~!”
She’s a lively little girl who never skips breakfast.
“Our Eunbyul, you woke up early today~?”
“Yeees~”
Since my husband worked late last night, I decided to let him sleep a little longer and got up first.“Eunbyul~ Let’s leave Appa to sleep and head to the living room with Amma. Up we go~!”
Carrying Eunbyul in my arms, I left the room. However, even as I stepped out, she waved her arms toward her sleeping father and called out,
“Appa! Appaaaa~!”
I carefully set Eunbyul down on the mattress in the living room.
“Appa wants to sleep a bit more, so let’s rest here for a while. Eunbyul, wait—hey, Eunbyul?!”
“Appa! Appaaaa!”
As soon as I set her down, Eunbyul dashed back into the bedroom.
It feels like just yesterday that she was crawling, but now she runs around the house so quickly!
In a flash, she grabbed the doorknob, opened the door, and climbed onto the bed to wake her father.
Pressing down on his arms and shaking them gently, Eunbyul managed to get him to open his eyes.
“My little girl is here~?”
“I’m here~!”
“Appa wants to sleep a little longer, though~”
“Nooo~”
Hearing Eunbyul’s firm response, my husband let out a small chuckle.
“Can’t Appa sleep a little longer~?”
“Nooo~!”
“Alright~ Appa will get up. Let’s go~”
In the end, Eunbyul brought her sleepy father into the living room with her.
“Honey, you can sleep a bit longer if you’re tired~”
“But our daughter says no. What choice do I have? Are you preparing breakfast? Let me help.”
“No, no~ Just play with Eunbyul in the living room.”
“Alright. Eunbyul, let’s play with Appa~”
“Okay~!”
“Eunbyul, what do you want to play? Go get what you want~”
At his words, Eunbyul hurried back to her room and returned with a picture book in hand.
The book was filled with animal pictures, which she eagerly handed to her father.
“Alright, come sit on Appa’s lap~”
“Okay~!”
Pointing to an animal in the book, my husband asked,
“Our smart girl, do you know what this is?”
“Bunny!”
“Wow~ So clever! What about this one?”
Thrilled by her father’s praise and gentle pat on her head, Eunbyul beamed and answered,
“Cluck-cluck!”
“Right! That’s a chicken. Another word for cluck-cluck is chicken. Can you say chicken?”
“Chicken~!”
“So smart! And what’s this?”
“Star!”
“Wow, you even know this one? You’re amazing! But I bet you don’t know this~”
Once again, Eunbyul answered confidently,
“Balloon!”
“Correct! It’s a balloon. What color is it?”
“Red~!”
“Wow~ You’re so good at this. Come here; Appa will give you an airplane ride!”
Putting the book aside, my husband lifted Eunbyul into the air.
“Whoosh~ Eunbyul is flying~ Whooooosh~”
Eunbyul giggled uncontrollably as her father carried her around the house, pretending she was soaring through the air.
Watching the happy duo, I turned my attention back to the kitchen and quickly started preparing breakfast.
I made fried eggs, which Eunbyul loves, and carefully plated them on her meal tray.
“Eunbyul~ Come get your spoon! Honey, come to the table, too~”
“Eunbyul, let’s go eat breakfast!”
“Okay~!”
“What do we do before eating?”
“Wash hands!”
“Let’s go wash hands with Appa~”
After washing her hands in the bathroom with her dad, Eunbyul opened the drawer by herself and picked out a small spoon.
She even closed the drawer after choosing it. Once seated in her chair, Eunbyul started eating on her own.
“Eunbyul seems to eat breakfast so well. Maybe she takes after you. You always make sure to eat in the morning.”
“Right? She’s such a good girl. Eunbyul, is breakfast delicious?”
“Yeees~”
“What’s the tastiest part?”
“The seaweed.”
Eunbyul chewed her food thoroughly as she ate. Her favorites are seaweed and eggs.
At first, she didn’t like zucchini, but after watching her mom and dad eat it happily, she now eats it without a fuss.
The saying that parents are a mirror for their children feels so true. Eunbyul mimics many of the actions and words my husband and I do.
“Honey, do you think we should send Eunbyul to daycare next year?”
“Hmm, some families start around this time, but I think it’s better for her to stay at home a bit longer. Let’s keep an eye on her for now. How does that sound?” ꭆᴀŊȮ₿Ɛs
“Yeah, nothing’s set in stone anyway. When Eunbyul goes to daycare, you’re planning to go back to college, right?”
“Of course. What about you? Aren’t you planning to go back too?”
Unlike me, who only has one semester left, my husband has quite a bit of college left.
“I’m going to talk to my company about it. I’m thinking of working only in the afternoons.”
“Our whole family will be going to daycare or college, huh?”
“Looks like it~ It might be fun going to college together with you.”
“I think so too~ Let’s take some time off occasionally and go on trips with Eunbyul.”
“Definitely. Let’s make it happen.”
After finishing breakfast, we spent the rest of the morning playing together as a family. Exhausted from all the fun, Eunbyul eventually fell asleep for her nap.
I carefully laid her down on the bed in her room and returned to the living room to spend some quiet time with my husband.
“How long do you think she’ll nap today?”
“If she naps deeply, it’ll probably be an hour. She even got an airplane ride this morning, so maybe longer. Why don’t you nap too? You worked late last night.”
“I’m fine~ Sleeping too much makes me even more tired. Are you okay?”
“I’m always fine when I’m with you~”
I leaned on my husband’s shoulder, and he gently wrapped his arm around me, pulling me close.
“Can you believe Eunbyul is already 21 months old? Time flies.”
“Right? When I was pregnant with her, I never imagined she’d grow this fast.”
“I know~ Before we know it, she’ll be in school and then an adult.”
“Even when she’s 20, we’ll still be in our 40s. I’m glad we got married early.”
“Looking back, yeah. But I was so nervous when I talked to your dad back then.”
“Are you still scared of him now?”
“Huh? Not at all. He treats me so well now.”
I think my dad has felt a little bad about being so stern back then, which is why he’s so kind to my husband now.
“You were so cool back then, though.”
“Really?”
“Yeah! You were so cool that I fell for you all over again.”
“That’s embarrassing~”
“You’re still cool. So, so cool.”
“And you’re always beautiful. Not a single moment when you’re not.”
“Hehe. Hearing that from you makes me so happy.”
My husband gently stroked my hair.
His touch always feels so comforting and warm, no matter when.
“You and Eunbyul both love it when I stroke your hair.”
“Yeah, but why does it feel so nice when you do it?”
“You’ve loved it since before we got married.”
“True, from the very beginning and all the way to now. I just love everything Gyeol do.”

“Good morning, Haeun’s dad~.”
“Good morning, Eunbyul’s dad~.”
The adults responded with warm smiles to the kids’ cheerful greetings.
“Good morning, Haeun~.”
“Good morning~.”
Then the parents exchanged nods as a gesture of greeting.

As I hesitated and leaned back slightly, my wife’s face shifted to a pout. Her cheeks puffed up, and she looked adorably frustrated.

****
“We’re here~”
As soon as we arrived at my in-laws’ house, Eunbyul, who had been sitting in the living room, came running toward us.
“Amma! Appa!”
My husband scooped up the running Eunbyul and held her in his arms.
“Our sweet Eunbyul~ Have you been listening to Grandma and Grandpa?”
“Yes!”
Right behind Eunbyul, my mother and father also came to greet us.
“You’re here? So, how’s the baby?”
“Doing really well! Oh, and we have something else to tell you too~”
“Alright, come on in.”
My husband and I took off our shoes and stepped inside the house. After washing our hands, we sat down in the living room. Eunbyul quickly climbed onto her appa’s lap.
“Oh my, look at her—sitting on her appa’s lap the moment he arrives. Does Eunbyul love her appa that much?”
“Yes!”
“You’re so lucky. Your adorable daughter just follows you around everywhere.”
“Haha, it’s probably only while she’s young. She won’t do this when she grows older.”
Hearing this, Eunbyul tilted her head in confusion.
“Why not?! I want to sit on Appa’s lap forever.”
“Really~? Even when Appa becomes an old, bent-over grandpa?”
“Then Appa can sit on my lap.”
“Pfft—! Alright, I’ll count on you, my sweet daughter~”
“Okay~”
The conversation veered off-topic for a bit, but my father brought it back.
“So, didn’t you say you had something to share? What is it?”
“We’re having twins!”
At my father’s question, I immediately answered.
After a brief moment of silence, my in-laws’ jaws dropped, and they exclaimed.
“What?! Twins?! Are you serious?!”
My husband and I nodded at my mother’s astonished reaction.
“Honey, did you hear that? We’re getting two more grandchildren.”
“You two surprised us when you told us about Eunbyul, and now you’ve done it again…”
“We were just as surprised! They’re fraternal twins.”
“Oh my~ Eunbyul, you must be so happy! You’re getting two siblings!”
My mother spoke to Eunbyul, who was still sitting on my husband’s lap.
“Yes! I’m super happy!”
Eunbyul smiled brightly at Grandma’s words, clearly overjoyed.
“Our son-in-law is going to have a lot on his plate. If it gets too much, let us know.”
My father gave my husband a sympathetic look, but my husband smiled sheepishly and replied.
“It’s alright. The timeline moved up a bit, but we always planned for four kids anyway. My wife always said two would never be enough.”
“I never thought she was serious about that…”
“Actually, neither did I…”
Both my father and husband turned to look at me.
“W-what?! I’ve always wanted four kids!”
“Amma, Amma, am I really getting another sibling?”
“Of course! Wouldn’t having three siblings be even better?”
“Hehe, I love it!”
“Alright, Amma and Appa will work even harder for you.”
“Okay~”
I can’t wait to have the twins and then our youngest child too.
“The more, the!”
When Eunbyul said that, everyone froze on the spot.
What?
-- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 167: Family (1)
chapters.content:
Quite some time had passed since the twins were born.
The second child was a healthy baby boy, Hanbyul, and the third was a healthy baby girl, Saetbyul.
The twins weren’t fussy and slept well, making parenting easier than expected.
However, they rarely smiled, which seemed to bother our eldest daughter.
“Hey, you two~ Can you smile for your Unnie? Peek-a-boo!”
Despite Eunbyul efforts, the twins barely reacted.
They tilted their heads with indifferent expressions, refusing to give her the smile she wanted.
“Appa…”
“Yes?”
“I think the twins don’t like me…”Come on, kids, give her a smile.
Maybe their reluctance to smile is something they inherited from me. Of all things to inherit…
As I pondered how to comfort her, my wife came out from the kitchen.
“That’s not true! The twins love you so much, Eunbyul~”
“Really?”
Sitting next to Eunbyul, my wife gently stroked her hair.
“Of course~ Now, can you step into your room for just a moment?”
“Okay~”
At her mother’s words, Eunbyul trotted off to her room.
The moment Eunbyul disappeared from the living room, the twins began to glance around…
“Waaaaahhhh!”
“Waaaaahhhh!”
Their loud cries echoed through the house.
“Eunbyul~ Come back quickly!”
“Coming~!”
As soon as Eunbyul returned to the living room, the twins immediately stopped crying.
Hanbyul and Saetbyul crawled toward Eunbyul and nestled next to her.
“See? The twins cry a lot when you’re not here. So make sure to stay with them often, okay?”
Eunbyul’s smile returned as she firmly held the twins’ hands.
“Hehe. Okay! Hanbyul, Saetbyul, let’s have lots of fun together!”
The three siblings sat in the middle of the living room, spending time together.
“How did you know? That the twins cry when Eunbyul isn’t around?”
“Well, Eunbyul takes such good care of her siblings, so they’ve grown really attached to her.”
“It’s so nice to see them getting along.”
“And the twins are growing so well. They’re calm, so raising them hasn’t been too difficult.”
“Yeah, they sleep well and don’t cause too much trouble.”
“Must take after you.”
My wife smiled softly and leaned her head on my shoulder.
“If you’re tired, take a nap. I’ll watch the kids.”
“But sitting here with you, watching the kids, makes me so happy~”
I gently held her hand.
She smiled warmly at my touch and leaned closer to me.
“I’m happy too.”
“Should we just go ahead and have our youngest now?”
“Maybe we should wait until the twins are in daycare?”
“But then the age gap between Eunbyul and the youngest might be too big.”
“You’re right.”
We were in a good place now, so having another child wouldn’t be a strain.
While the idea of having another child brought joy, I couldn’t ignore the burden it might place on my wife.
“Let’s think about it step by step.”
“Okay, no rush. I wasn’t being entirely serious anyway.”
“So, you were kind of serious~?”
“Hehe. You caught me.”
She was as adorable and lovely as ever.
“Amma! Appa!”
As I admired my wife, Eunbyul called out to us loudly.
“Yes, Eunbyul? What is it?”
My wife and I both turned to look at the children, and the twins—
“The twins are standing up!”
They were standing on their own, balancing on the floor.
Seeing this, my wife and I immediately jumped off the sofa.
“Wowww!”
“Wooow!”
We cheered loudly, and the twins burst into laughter.
We clapped and encouraged the twins, who took a few steps in different directions before plopping back down.
I scooped them up in my arms and lifted them high into the air as my wife and Eunbyul clapped and ran around the living room.
“Oh, my precious twins~ I’m so proud of you!”
“Appa! Me too! Lift me too!”
“Of course~ Our amazing Eunbyul!”
After setting the twins back on the floor, I lifted Eunbyul high into the air.
The more kids we had, the more laughter filled our home.
I couldn’t be happier.
****
After putting all the kids to bed, my wife and I returned to the living room.
We hugged each other, sharing silent encouragement, grateful for surviving another day.
Still, it felt like a waste to just go to bed on such a peaceful night.
“Hey, want to share a can of beer before we call it a night?”
“Ooh! Let’s do it! I’ve been feeling the same way!”
“You sit on the sofa and relax. I’ll handle everything.”
“Hehe, alright~”
I left her on the sofa to rest and quickly prepared some snacks.
After setting the beer and food on the coffee table, I carefully opened a can of beer.
If even one of the twins woke up, this heavenly moment would come to an abrupt end.
Ssssshhhhh...!
The sound was unbelievably soft and cautious.
The absurdity of being so meticulous over something so trivial made both of us stifle our laughter.
It was funny how two grown adults acted like teens sneaking drinks.
“Pfft...!”
“Shh, honey! If the kids wake up, we won’t even get a sip.”
“I know, but this is too funny! Open mine too.”
“Alright, watch this.”
Ssshhhk!
I misjudged my strength, and the can popped open with a crisp sound that echoed in the living room.
Eyes wide, we instinctively locked gazes.
“That was close!”
“Yeah, I almost had a heart attack!”
Thankfully, the disaster was averted.
“Cheers, honey!”
“Yeah! Cheers!”
We carefully clinked our cans together with a soft tap.
The moment felt more thrilling and joyful than ever.
She took a sip of her beer, then a bite of the snacks, her face lighting up with a smile.
Her happiness was contagious, making her all the more lovable.
Then, she reached over to feed me a bite.
“Say ah~”
“Ah~”
She watched me eat with a look of pure delight.
“Why are you looking at me like that?”
“Just because. How is it that you’re getting even more handsome?”
“I think that’s just how you see me.”
She shook her head firmly.
“No way. You’ve gotten even more dashing. Why are you so amazing?”
“Ah, stop! You’re embarrassing me!”
I turned my head and sipped my beer to hide my flushed face.
She giggled, enjoying my reaction.
“Hehe, honey, do you still get shy when I compliment you?”
“I never said I was shy.”
“Yes, you do~”
From the day we met, she’s always looked at me with such affection.
I thought that over time, it might fade, but every time I saw that expression, my heart still fluttered.
“How can anyone not feel shy when you look at them like that?”
“Huh? How do I look at you?”
She asked, genuinely curious.
It felt embarrassing to explain.
“Just look in a mirror.”
“No, tell me! Please, honey~”
Her playful insistence finally made me cave.
“Then... You always look at me like I’m...”
“Like you’re...?”
“The most precious thing in the world.”
Her eyebrows lifted slightly in surprise.
“When you look at me like that, I feel like I’m someone amazing. It’s hard to explain, but that look gives me so much strength. Even when I’m tired or overwhelmed, seeing your expression lifts me up. It’s not overbearing; it’s comforting, like genuine encouragement.”
She smiled warmly as she responded.
“You are amazing.”
“That’s such an embarrassing thing to say!”
“It’s not just empty words, you know?”
She shook her head, her voice filled with conviction.
“You’re incredible—not just as my husband, but as a person. You’re someone admirable, responsible, and inspiring. I don’t just look at you that way—you make me look at you that way.”
Her words pierced deep into my heart, as if they’d always belonged there.
“I love you, honey.”
Her confession filled me with so much warmth that I lowered my head, resting it in my hand.
“Seriously… Why are you so lovable? You make me feel dizzy.”
“Really? Have you fallen for me again? Go ahead! Fall as much as you want—I fall for you every day!”
“What did I do today that made you fall for me?”
“When you lifted both twins at once, I thought you were so dependable.”
“I’ve still got muscles, you know. Want me to lift you too?”
“Yes, please!”
“Get on the sofa.”
“Alright~”
As soon as she climbed onto the sofa, I hoisted her over my shoulder.
“Ahhh! This is fun!”
“Let’s make it even better!”
I playfully lifted and spun her, pretending to give her a ride.
We were laughing like kids when suddenly, the bedroom door creaked open.
Our eldest, Eunbyul, stepped out in her pajamas and looked at us sternly.
“What if you wake the twins? Please play quietly, okay?”
Her firm tone made us freeze for a moment before we meekly replied.
“Okay...”
“Yes, ma’am...”
“Alright, goodnight.”
With that, Eunbyul coolly went back to her room.
Carefully setting my wife back down, we exchanged glances and burst into silent laughter, stifling our giggles behind our hands.
It was another joyful, chaotic day in our happy little family.
-- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 168: Family (2)
chapters.content:
The twins had grown up healthy and were now attending daycare.
Our eldest daughter had started elementary school, and we had officially entered our thirties.
Over the years, I had become the head of a small editing team, while my husband continued working at his company, dreaming of starting his own business.
Honestly, he could open his practice right away, but we decided to hold off until our youngest—currently growing inside my belly—was born.
“Ammaaa—! Saetbyul is being mean!”
“Ammaaaa—! Oppa started it!”
The twins often bickered, but they never got into serious fights.
Whenever they disagreed, rather than arguing endlessly, they would come running to me or my husband to settle things.
“What’s wrong, my little twins?”
“You know how we’re going on a trip next week? I want to go to the zoo, but Oppa says he wants to go to the aquarium!”“The aquarium is way cooler than the zoo! You’ve never even seen a dolphin before!”
“Well, you’ve never seen a tiger either! Tigers are way cooler!”
Born at the same time, yet always so different.
“Dolphins are the best!”
“No way! Tigers are better!”
“Dolphins!”
“Tigers!”
“Dolphins!”
“Tigers!”
The twins were noisy, but there was one thing that always worked like magic to quiet them down.
Click. The sound of a door opening.
As soon as Eunbyul stepped out of her room, they flinched and scurried behind me.
Our eldest daughter, eyes gleaming with authority, scanned the room until she found them.
“Lee Hanbyul. Lee Saetbyul…! How many times have I told you not to bother Amma?! You two are older siblings now—act like it!”
“W-We weren’t bothering her! We were just asking Amma whether we should go to the zoo or the aquarium next week!”
“Y-Yeah! That’s all!”
“Settle it fairly with rock-paper-scissors. No complaining afterward. Got it? Go.”
At Eunbyul’s firm ruling, the twins glared at each other, then raised their hands high in the air.
“Rock, paper, scissors—shoot!”
Hanbyul threw out paper.
SaetByul played rock.
Hanbyul clenched his fist in victory, while Saetbyeol collapsed onto the floor dramatically.
“Yes! Aquarium it is!”
“Hmph…! But next time, we’re going to the zoo!”
It was fascinating how they accepted the outcome so cleanly.
Each child had such a distinct personality—it was truly amazing.
As the kids lounged in the living room, we suddenly heard the front door open.
My husband had returned, carrying the cake the kids had been craving.
“Appa’s home~”
The moment they heard their dad’s voice, the twins bolted toward the entrance.
But before they could reach it, Eunbyul grabbed their collars, stopping them in their tracks.
“Didn’t I tell you not to run in the house?”
The twins drooped in defeat.
“Yes…”
“Kids, go wash your hands. Let’s eat some cake.”
“Okay~!”
The children ran off to the bathroom, quickly washing their hands before gathering in the kitchen.
“You’re home earlier than I expected.”
“Well, you and the kids wanted cake, so I hurried back.”
“Seriously~ There was no need to rush! Just sit and relax. I’ll set everything up.”
“Nope, I’ll do it.”
After washing his hands at the sink, my husband set out plates and poured glasses of milk.
“Honey, aren’t you spoiling me too much~?”
“Then stop being so lovable. It’s your fault.”
“What~? You’re embarrassing me~”
“Now, go wash your hands and sit down.”
“Yes, sir~”
As I settled into my chair, the kids returned.
“We washed our hands~!”
“Good job. You made sure they’re clean, right?”
“Yes~!”
Once everyone was seated, my husband sliced the cake and placed a piece on each plate.
With glasses of milk in front of them, the kids eagerly dug into their treats.
“It’s always so quiet when they’re eating.”
Even at my husband’s amused remark, the kids only grinned, too busy enjoying their cake.
Afterward, we all spent time together in the living room.
I had always dreamed of peaceful weekends like this—just sitting in the living room with my family.
And now, that dream had come true.
There was nothing better than being together.
“Appa! Airplane ride!”
“Yeah! You promised to give us airplane rides this weekend!”
Even though my husband was exhausted, the twins were relentless, shaking him awake.
“You two have an incredible memory…”
“Come on, hurry up!”
“Alright, alright. Airplane ride, coming up~”
Lifting his heavy body off the couch, my husband picked up the twins, one under each arm, and zoomed them around the house.
“Vrooooom~!”
Laughter filled the air as the twins giggled uncontrollably.
Eunbyul, however, simply watched from the sidelines without saying a word.
Noticing this, my husband quickly set the twins down on the couch and turned to Eunbyul.
“Come here, our Eunbyul. It’s been a while since you had an airplane ride too!”
“Okay..!”
Despite being responsible and mature beyond her years, Eunbyul was still just a child.
Knowing that, my husband always made sure to include her in everything.
“Vrooooom~!”
After giving all three kids their airplane rides, my husband collapsed onto the floor in exhaustion.
“Ahhh-! That wasn’t enough! More!”
“My fuel’s all out…”
“Saetbyeol! Go get some cake from the kitchen!”
“On it! Fuel delivery coming up~!”
In the end, after downing another slice of cake, my husband spent over an hour playing with the kids.
Watching them together like this, I couldn’t help but smile.
“Really~ I love them all so much.”
I was happy.
No—I was incredibly, unbelievably happy.
****
There Are Many Photos on My Desk
A picture of just my wife and me.
A picture of my wife, Eunbyul, and me.
A picture of my wife, Eunbyul, and the twins.
And finally, a recent picture of the whole family, now including our youngest, who was born not too long ago.
Whenever I feel exhausted from work, I glance at these photos and find myself smiling without realizing it.
“Ahh… finally done.”
By the time I finished today’s work, it was already past office hours.
I slowly packed up my things, got into my car in the underground parking lot, and drove home.
“I wonder if the kids are playing well… I can’t wait to see them.”
Every day after work, my wife greets me with a warm hug, and the kids come running to the front door no matter what they’re doing.
It has become a part of my daily life, yet it’s something I cherish and look forward to every single day.
After parking in the apartment lot, I quickly took the elevator up to our home.
With an excited heart, I entered the passcode at the front door.
The moment I stepped inside, the kids rushed toward me.
“Daaaaad—!”
The twins were always the first to charge at me.
They raced each other to see who could reach me first, and as soon as I picked them both up in my arms, Eunbyul walked over more calmly, greeting me with a polite bow.
“Welcome home.”
“I’m home~”
Finally, my wife approached me, cradling our youngest, Geumbyeol, in her arms.
She was as beautiful as ever, her bright smile always welcoming me home.
“Honey, you’re back?”
“Yeah, I’m home.”
“Baaa~!”
Even little Geumbyeol waved his tiny hands in greeting.
“Oh~ Were you a good baby today, Geumbyeol~?”
“Say ‘Yes~’ Geumbyeol~”
“Baah~!”
“That means yes~”
“You must be tired from watching the kids all day. Let me take Geumbyeol.”
“I’m fine~ Go change out of your work clothes first. Kids, let Appa go change now~”
“Okay~”
At my wife’s words, the twins quickly climbed down from my arms.
After changing into comfortable clothes, I came back and took Geumbyeol into my arms.
While I held the baby, my wife and the kids began setting up the dinner table.
Eunbyul took out side dishes from the fridge, while the twins placed bowls and utensils on the table.
Finally, my wife set down rice and a steaming pot of stew, and just like that, dinner was ready.
“Our family is so well-organized. Doesn’t it feel like we’re super efficient?”
“I think so too~ We’re really lucky to have such wonderful kids. Where else would we find children this sweet and helpful?”
At my wife’s praise, the kids beamed proudly, having completed their tasks.
Sometimes, our house felt chaotic, but other times, it was astonishingly systematic.
“We just learned it from Amma and Appa~”
“Ah! I was going to say that first—!”
Hanbyul quickly made a witty remark, and SaetByul immediately jumped in to counter it.
“Then you should’ve said it faster—!”
“Can’t you wait for me for once?!”
You’d think twins born at the same time would get along perfectly, but they were always bickering whenever they got the chance.
Even so, even their little fights felt like a precious part of my daily happiness.
“Hey…”
But of course, their quarrel ended instantly with just one word from Eunbyul.
“Sorry, Saetbyeol.”
“No, Oppa. I’m sorry too.”
“Let’s make up.”
“Okay.”
They fought often, but they made up just as quickly.
It was clear that, despite everything, they were a little scared of Eunbyul.
“I really don’t know how you all ended up being this adorable. Must be because you take after Amma.”
“We take after both Amma and Appa—! Aha! This time, I said it before Oppa did—!”
“Haha, you’re all amazing. My wonderful kids.”
When I smiled and praised them, all three kids grinned back at me with bright, loving smiles.
“Baaah~!”
Even little Geumbyeol squirmed in my arms, flashing a tiny, joyful grin.
“That’s right. You’re amazing too, Geumbyeol~”
My life right now is so full of love.
So vibrant.
So beautiful.
-- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 169: Family (3)
chapters.content:
Since it was a rare summer vacation, we decided to take a family trip to Gangneung.
My wife looked incredibly happy, finally going on the family trip she had promised herself back in her college days.
Of course, the kids also beamed with excitement the moment we arrived at the beach.
“It’s the ocean—!”
“Wooooow—!”
As soon as the twins stepped onto the sandy shore, they let out excited cheers.
After setting up the beach umbrella, I reminded them of the safety rules once again before we went into the water.
“What did Appa say you absolutely must not do?”
“Never go off alone! Never take off our life jackets! And never leave Appa’s side!”
“That’s right! No matter what happens, you have to stay close to Appa, got it?! Eunbyul, just because you’re older doesn’t mean you can play by yourself, okay?”“Yes~”
I couldn’t even count how many times I had drilled the safety rules into them for today.
While my wife sat under the umbrella with Geumbyeol, I put the kids onto a boat tube and stepped into the water.
Even though it was a very shallow area, I couldn’t afford to let my guard down with them.
“Waaaah! This is so much fun!”
“Right? Alright, now let’s take turns getting off the boat. Eunbyul goes first~”
“Okay~”
Eunbyul was the first to get off the boat and step into the water.
The coolness of the sea must have felt nice because she flashed a bright smile and clung tightly to my arm.
Once all the twins had gotten off, the four of us held hands and enjoyed the water together.
All we did was float lazily, but the kids giggled and shrieked with joy as if it were the most exciting thing in the world.
“Alright~ Let’s wave to Amma~”
When we all raised our hands and waved, my wife and Geumbyeol, who were under the umbrella, waved back.
Every now and then, my wife dipped her feet into the water, enjoying the moment with Geumbyeol.
The kids were all grinning from ear to ear, but as time passed, my energy was quickly draining.
Just when it felt like the fun would never end, our time in the water finally came to a close, and we made our way to a nearby restaurant by the beach.
“Huh? This place turned into a barbecue restaurant?”
As we arrived in front of the restaurant, my wife muttered something unexpected.
“Honey, don’t you remember? Ten years ago, we had shellfish here.”
“Oh—! Was this that place?”
When I glanced behind the restaurant, the view brought back memories—it was exactly the same as back then.
“Amma, Appa, you’ve been here before?”
“Yes, Amma and Appa came here when we were in college~”
“Wow, time really flew by. That was already ten years ago?”
“Honey, let’s go inside. Come on, kids, let’s head in. No being loud inside, okay?”
“Yes~”
After settling at a table, we ordered meat right away.
I was busy taking care of the kids, barely touching my own food, but seeing that, the kids took it upon themselves to make me a lettuce wrap and feed me.
“Appa, say ah~”
I happily accepted the lettuce wrap made by my eldest daughter.
Come to think of it, ten years ago, my wife had also fed me when we came here.
I suddenly recalled her face as she insisted I eat all the oysters, saying they were good for men.
As I chuckled at the memory, my wife, who was sitting across from me, smiled warmly.
“Honey, what’s so funny all of a sudden?”
“I just remembered how you fed me shrimp back then.”
“You still remember that?”
“Of course. It was our first trip together.”
“We were so young back then~”
“You’re just as beautiful now as you were then.”
“Hehe~ Hearing that makes me happy.”
Raising kids had made a wedding ceremony impossible, and going on a trip alone as a couple was out of the question.
At one point, I had gently suggested we could have a wedding later, but my wife had waved it off, saying it wasn’t necessary.
Even so, I knew she must have dreamed of that moment at some point.
She just never had the luxury to think about it while raising the kids.
But now that we had some stability and the children were growing up healthy, maybe… just maybe, it wasn’t too late.
“Appa, say ah~”
This time, my youngest daughter snapped me out of my thoughts by holding up a lettuce wrap for me.
After stuffing ourselves with barbecue, we left the restaurant and walked toward our lodging.
“Kids, did you enjoy the food?”
“Yes~ We ate so much—!”
“Good job~”
After dinner, we went to a café overlooking the beach for dessert.
The sunset outside was breathtaking, stealing the kids’ attention.
Even Geumbyeol, who was snuggled in my wife’s arms, gazed at the sunset.
“Honey, coming here with the kids makes it even better. It’s so beautiful.”
My wife muttered as she admired the sunset.
But for me, then and now, the most beautiful thing wasn’t the view outside—it was her.
“Yes. You’re still as beautiful as ever.”
****
As we walked back to our lodging after watching the sunset, the kids suddenly pointed excitedly at something.
“Amma! Appa! That place sells lottery!”
“How much do you win if you hit the jackpot? Can we buy a tiger?”
“You idiot—why would you buy a tiger? Are you planning to keep it at home?”
“Yup! I’ll buy a tiger and make it eat you, oppa!”
“What?! Then I’ll buy a dolphin and make it eat you!”
The twins were at it again, bickering as usual.
But before I could step in, Eunbyul handled it in my place.
“Both of you, be quiet before I eat you first.”
“Yes…”
We were about to keep walking when Geumbyeol suddenly squirmed in my wife’s arms.
“Awooo—!”
“Oh my, is our Geumbyeol interested in the lottery too? Honey, should we buy a ticket since we’re here?”
“Well, it is Saturday, so why not?”
At our conversation, the kids’ eyes sparkled with excitement.
Maybe they took after me—they seemed to have quite the interest in money.
In the end, we stopped by the lottery shop and bought a 5,000-won quick-pick ticket before heading back.
The kids gathered around the ticket, staring at it in fascination, gently running their fingers over it as if it were some sacred artifact.
“Be careful with that, alright? In just a few hours, this little piece of paper could be worth 1.3 billion won.”
“1.3 billion?! What can we do with that much money?”
At Hanbyul’s question, I smirked and said,
“You can do anything you want.”
“Wooooow! That’s so cool!”
“So, what would you all do if we won the lottery?”
At my wife’s question, the kids eagerly shouted their answers one by one.
First, our eldest, Eunbyul, spoke up.
“I’d buy gold.”
“Huh? Why gold?”
“Because currency value drops over time.”
“…Where did you even learn that?”
“The news.”
She gave such a mature response that I regretted not letting her watch more cartoons as a child.
The twins, on the other hand, had much more creative ideas.
“I’d buy a giant robot to ride to daycare! One that shoots beams from its hands! And it can fly through the sky! And defeat villains!”
Lately, Hanbyul had been completely obsessed with a recent sci-fi movie, shifting his interests from cars to robots.
Although I was a bit concerned about his new habit of blocking the path of our robot vacuum…
Just the other day, he even asked me to take it apart so he could install sensors on himself.
“What about you, Saetbyul?”
“I want to raise a dog!”
“Oooh~ What kind of dog? Do you have a breed in mind?”
“A Doberman!”
“D-Doberman…?”
“Or maybe a German Shepherd!”
Even though she was my daughter, I had to admit she had quite the unique taste.
But unfortunately, living in an apartment meant we couldn’t have a big dog.
“That’s too bad—we live in an apartment, so we can’t raise a dog.”
“That’s okay! If we win 1.3 billion, we can just buy a house where we can have a dog!”
The fact that she had already thought that far ahead left me speechless.
“And what about our little Geumbyeol? What do you want to do if we win?”
“Awoooo—!”
After hearing all their answers, we finally arrived back at the lodging.
I bathed the kids first before washing up myself.
“Honey, I’m done. You should go shower too.”
“Okay. Here, hold Geumbyeol for a bit.”
“Alright, come here, Geumbyeol, come to Appa~”
“Awoo—!”
I held Geumbyeol in my arms and sat down on the bed.
“Appa! When do we find out if we won the lottery?”
“Hm? What time is it now?”
“It’s 8:30!”
“Oh—then the live draw is about to start. Alright, everyone, let’s gather around and watch with high hopes!”
The kids sat beside me, their eyes glued to the television.
After a brief recap of the previous draw, the real lottery broadcast finally began.
“It’s starting…!”
All of them went completely silent, fixated on the screen.
Even though winning the lottery was nearly impossible, their faces were filled with hopeful anticipation.
- We will now begin today’s draw. Regardless of the order in which the numbers appear, matching any of them makes you a winner. Let’s start the draw. The first lucky number is… 1!
“It’s 1! Eunbyul, do we have a 1?!”
At Saetbyul’s question, Eunbyul stared at the ticket intently.
But soon, she let out a deep sigh and shook her head.
“Nope…”
“Aaaaah, so close!”
“My… my robot…”
“My Doberman…”
As the kids slumped in disappointment, the draw continued.
“It’s okay~ The lottery is just for fun. Let’s win next time, okay?”
I reassured them, thinking that at the very least, this had been a fun experience.
But just as the final bonus number appeared on the screen, I noticed Eunbyul’s hands trembling slightly.
“Um… Appa…!”
“Hm? What is it, Eunbyul?”
“What’s the rule for the bonus number?”
“Oh, if you match five numbers and the bonus number, you win second place.”
“How much is second place…?”
Her voice shook as she looked up at me, her lower eyelid quivering.
“Sweetheart…? Why do you ask…?”
“Am I… seeing things? I think we got second place…”
“Come on~ That’s—”
“Look…!”
She shoved the ticket into my hands, her face tense with anticipation.
I glanced at the ticket and compared it to the numbers on the TV screen.
A single bead of cold sweat dripped down my cheek—
Plop.
It landed right on Geumbyeol’s forehead.
“Awoo—?”
And then—
I froze.
My mouth fell open, my body stiffening in shock.
The kids, noticing my reaction, huddled around me, peering at the ticket in stunned silence.
Just then, my wife stepped out of the bathroom, her hair wrapped in a towel, and looked at us with confusion.
“Why do you all look like that?”
Carefully, I lifted Geumbyeol off my lap and passed her over to Eunbyul.
Then, I slowly got up and walked toward my wife.
“Honey?”
“Sweetheart.”
“What’s wrong?”
I looked at her, smiled brightly, and let the words slip out.
“Let’s have a wedding.”
“…What?! All of a sudden?!”
-- The End OF The Chapter --

chapters.title: Chapter 170: The Wedding (The End)
chapters.content:
Thanks to the little blessings that came into our lives, my husband and I decided to finally hold our wedding ceremony, even if it was a bit late.
Honestly, I didn’t think having a wedding was all that necessary, but once we decided to go through with it, I couldn’t help but feel a little excited.
I was curious about what kind of expression my husband would make when he saw me in my wedding dress, and I also wondered how our children would react.
But as it turned out, planning a wedding involved much more preparation than I had expected.
Above all, choosing a wedding dress was no easy task.
Still, when I finally stepped out wearing the dress, my husband and children stood there, mouths agape, staring at me.
Seeing them so dumbfounded was absolutely priceless.
They couldn’t say a word, just standing there in a daze, staring at me—oh, how I enjoyed that moment.
They looked so adorable, so unbelievably precious.
And just like that, the dress was chosen, and our wedding day arrived.My colleagues from work and my university friends came to the bridal waiting room, and finally, Harim walked in.
“Wow…! Eun-ha, you look absolutely stunning.”
“Haha, you’re making me shy…! I never thought I’d be having a wedding after having kids.”
Harim sat beside me, her face beaming as she looked at me.
“It doesn’t matter if it’s late~ You’re the most beautiful bride today, Eun-ha.”
“Hehe, really? This feels a little embarrassing.”
“Haa— I can’t wait to wear my wedding dress too.”
“Your wedding is next spring, right, Harim?”
“Yeah. We originally planned for winter, but Jang Yujin threw such a fit about having it in spring that I had no choice but to agree.”
“Haha, so Jang Yujin can be a little stubborn, huh?”
“Well, it’s kind of cute in its own way~ I just hope he does a good job as the emcee today.”
“Tell him not to be nervous~ And tell him I really appreciate it.”
After many years of dating, Harim and Jang Yujin were finally set to marry next spring.
“He’s been practicing his lines for days, so I doubt he’ll mess up. I mean, all he has to do is read them—why is he so nervous about it?”
“My husband is really grateful, and so am I~”
“No worries~ Besides, Lee Han-gyeol will be the emcee for my wedding anyway.”
“Oh, really?”
“Yep. Anyway, I should head to the hall now. I need to help Yujin relax.”
“Alright! See you later, and thanks for coming.”
“Of course~ And I’ll be catching that bouquet!”
Harim left the waiting room.
I tried not to show it too much, but my heart was racing with excitement.
I hadn’t put much thought into it before, but now that I was sitting here in a wedding dress, ready to marry my husband, I couldn’t be happier.
Even though I was just sitting alone in the waiting room, I couldn’t stop smiling.
I clutched the bouquet in my hands and tapped my feet anxiously.
“Haah…! What do I do? I’m so happy..!”
I mean it—I was really happy.
So much so that I almost wondered if I even deserved to feel this much joy.
Just then, I heard the microphone outside, signaling the start of the ceremony.
My heart pounded.
This was it—the moment I had been waiting for.
From the day I met my husband until now, there had never been a single moment of unhappiness.
Every second spent with him had been filled with joy, and I knew that would never change.
Hiding my smile behind my bouquet, I waited for my cue when one of the staff members approached me.
“Bride, it’s time to move.”
“Ah—yes!”
There was still some time before my grand entrance, but I wanted to watch the twins make their entrance as the flower children.
So, I headed out a little early.
Standing in a dimly lit corner of the wedding hall, behind the blackout curtain, I saw my father waiting for me, dressed up in his finest suit.
“Dad~”
“There you are, my daughter~”
“Did you see my husband enter?”
“I did. He looked strong and reliable.”
“Right? He’s my husband, after all.”
“He is. Now, the twins are about to enter. Keep your eyes on them.”
“Got it~”
I carefully peeked through the curtain and looked inside.
The hall was packed with guests, and our parents from both sides were sitting in the front.
And then, at the end of the aisle, I saw my husband standing tall and proud.
He was always handsome, but today, he was so breathtakingly dashing that I couldn’t take my eyes off him.
Haa… what do I do? Now I want a fifth child…
“B-bride, please… you’re staring too much, someone might see you…!”
“Ah…! S-sorry.”
“Now, let us welcome the flower children who will brighten this ceremony even more! Today’s flower children are none other than the children of the bride and groom—the lovely twin siblings! Flower children, please enter!”
Under the dazzling lights, the twins walked down the aisle, scattering flower petals along the way.
Even though they could have been nervous, they simply smiled happily as they walked.
They looked so precious, so perfect, that I couldn’t help but push the curtain open a little more.
“Aah… they’re too adorable…! I want to run over and hug them—!”
“B-bride..?! If you keep leaning out like that, people will see you…!”
The twins walked forward, flashing their sweetest smiles at the guests.
Haa… I know I gave birth to them, but I swear, I’m not even exaggerating—they are the most precious, lovable children in the world.
And then, beyond them, I saw our eldest daughter holding Geumbyeol in her arms.
Oh no. What do I do? I want to run out there right now and scoop them all up in my arms.
“Sweetheart, you’re going to get caught if you keep peeking like that.”
“Okay, okay, I’ll stop~ I’ll just watch the video later on repeat~”
“-What an absolutely beautiful sight. Now, it’s time for today’s most beautiful bride, Shin Eun-ha, to make her entrance. Please welcome her with a warm round of applause! Bride, enter!-”
As the blackout curtain slowly drew back, I stepped into the wedding hall.
All eyes turned to me, and though I felt a little shy, happiness outweighed my embarrassment.
With my father by my side, I took slow, careful steps forward.
With each step, I got closer to my husband, who was watching me with so much love in his eyes.
Just looking at him made me smile—he was already the most handsome man in the world, but today, he looked even more incredible.
When I finally reached him, I moved my arm from my father’s to my husband’s.
I smiled up at my father, and he returned the gesture with a warm, proud smile before stepping away to take his seat.
“-Now, before our family, friends, and all the honored guests here today, the bride and groom will recite their vows. Bride and groom, please take your vows in hand and share them with everyone.”
I’m so happy.
Holding the wedding vows handed to me by the staff, I listened as my husband read his first.
“I vow to love the most beautiful Eun-ha for the rest of my life.”
“I swear to love the most wonderful Han-gyeol for the rest of my life.”
We locked eyes as we continued reading our vows.
“I promise to work hard to build the happiest family in the world.”
“I promise to be a loving wife and mother, standing by my husband and our family.”
And then, together, we spoke the final line in unison.
“We will always be each other’s pillar of strength and source of joy, loving one another until the very end of our days. Thank you.”
As soon as we finished, a wave of applause filled the hall.
I glanced over and saw our children grinning widely, watching us with pure joy.
“-Thank you for the warm applause. Now, it’s time for the bride and groom to exchange their wedding rings, symbolizing their love for one another. First, the groom, Lee Han-gyeol, will place the ring on the bride, Shin Eun-ha’s hand.”
I slowly lifted my hand, and my husband gently slid the ring onto my finger.
Haa… Oh my god… I love him so much. I want to throw my arms around him and kiss him right now.
Next, I placed the ring on his finger.
Following that was the declaration of marriage, warm blessings from our guests, a heartfelt wedding song performed by my colleagues, and a letter of gratitude to our parents.
With each moment, our wedding ceremony inched toward its end.
“-Now, in front of all our guests, the newlyweds will take each other’s hands and make their way down the aisle together. Please give them one final, resounding round of applause as we celebrate their new journey as husband and wife!”
Ah—this might just be the happiest day of my life.
“Honey.”
“Hmm? Babe?”
“I’m so happy. Today is the happiest day of my life.”
Hearing my words, my husband gave me that signature, warm smile of his before replying:
“Then let’s be even happier tomorrow.”
Even though I told him today was the happiest day, he still wanted tomorrow to be even better.
Seriously… I can never win against him.
There’s no way I’ll ever be able to break free from him—not when he makes me fall for him all over again, every single day.
“Okay. Let’s be even happier tomorrow—!”
“As long as I have you, every day is happiness.”
“And as long as I have you, I’ll always be happy. Thank you, my love.”
“No, I should be the one thanking you~”
“I’m so lucky to love you.”
“That’s the best compliment ever~”
“I mean it. Thank you… for coming into my life.”
I beamed up at my husband, and he gave me the brightest, most radiant smile in return.
“Thank you… for letting me be a part of your life. I love you.”
“I love you too, my love.”
“-Bride and groom, march forward!”
With the beautiful sound of a piano playing in the background, my husband and I stepped forward together.
The thunderous applause from our guests, the warm smiles of our family, and the sight of our children watching us with joy—it all felt so perfect.
As long as I have my husband and our children, I know every moment will be filled with happiness.
I can’t wait for tomorrow.
The new day we’ll share together.
A tomorrow that will be even happier than today.
-- The End OF The Chapter --
